Nena tiene 28 años, soltera y con una gran responsabilidad familiar por sus padres y hermanos menores, además tiene una hija de 11 años. Ella reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble que logró construir con mucho sacrificio.
Se desempeña como cosmetóloga y peluquera desde hace 3 años en un pequeño local alquilado. Comenta que al inicio no fue sencillo sacar adelante su negocio a falta de clientes pero que gracias a su paciencia y buen trato a logrado consolidar su negocio como un buen sustento para su economía familiar. 
Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que se considera una persona detallista y capaz de desempeñar en esta actividad.
A manera de seguir mejorando su negocio desea realizar la compra de más mercadería cosmética e incrementar la afluencia de clientes en su negocio.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a desplazarse a una ciudad mas grande e iniciar un negocio del mismo rubro pero a gran escala , esperando crecer como microempresaria en bienestar de su pequeña hija.
En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles  para la compra de cosméticos, tintes y productos de belleza para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nena is 28 years old and single. She has a great sense of familial responsibility for her parents and younger siblings, as well as for her own 11-year-old daughter.  She lives in a home made of quality construction materials, which she managed to build with much sacrifice.  She has worked as a cosmetologist and hairdresser for the last 3 years in a small salon that she rents.  

Nena comments that at the beginning it was not easy to advance her business because she lacked customers, but thanks to her patience and good service she has managed to strengthen her business so it can economically sustain her family.  She likes her work very much, and considers herself to be detail-oriented and capable of performing in this business. 

In order to continue improving her business, she wants to buy more cosmetic merchandise and increase customer traffic to her salon.  Her future plans are to move to a bigger city and start a similar business that is larger scale, hoping to grow as a micro-entrepreneur to support the well-being of her young daughter.  On this occasion, she hopes to rely on this loan of 2,000 soles to buy cosmetics, dyes and beauty products to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, dyes and beauty products to improve her business.

loans.name: Liangale Group

texts.en:
Mary’s group has 13 farmers and is located in Kakamega south District. Mary is pictured on the right of the Liangege Group with her hand raised. Mary is pictured amongst the five men and eight women of her group. She will receive input loans allowing her to plant ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Mary joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Mary joined One Acre Fund so that she could have a bumper harvest like her mum.

Mary reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about one bag of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested six bags per 1/2 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Mary’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 6.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is 56 years old, single and lives alone in Tkibuli District. Tariel runs an agricultural business. In particular, he owns beehives with bee colonies and sells the honey for a good price. Besides, he grows maize on the family-owned land and sells the harvested products seasonally. In addition, Tariel works as a joiner and earns monthly income. He is a very hard-working man with great experience in his work. 
He has requested a loan to renovate his house. His existing house is old and damaged. Tariel will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, his living conditions will improve and Tariel will be able to spend his evenings in a more comfortable environment after a hard day of work. Tariel hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Papa Moussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Pape moussa est un homme célibataire. Il vit au Sénégal et pratique l’activité de  commerce depuis plus de 08 ans. Il vend des articles de mercerie et des produits cosmétiques. Il est membre  de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC où il sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 60.000 francs CFA dans le but de remettre en état le magasin ou il exerce son activité. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne au sein de sa famille. Sa journée de travail  commence a 8 heures et se termine a 20 heures la nuit. Son objectif avec a travers la réfection de son magasin est d’attirer beaucoup plus de client afin d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et ses bénéfices, ce qui lui permettra de diversifier les produits qu’il commercialise. Il souhaite démarrer la vente de tissus et aussi élargir le nombre de ses employés à 2. Ainsi il pourra  contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions alimentaires au sein de sa famille. Son projet dans le futur consiste a mieux développer son activité de commerce et acquérir un magasin  plus spacieux afin de pouvoir satisfaire entièrement la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Papa Moussa is single and lives in Senegal.  He has been working in commerce for more than eight years, selling sewing supplies and cosmetic products.  He is a client of one of UIMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 60,000 CFA francs to renovate his store.

With his income, he is able to contribute to the day-to-day expenses, within his family.  He works from 8 AM until 8 PM.  He wants to renovate his store in order to attract a much larger group of customers and increase his turnover and profits, which will allow him to diversify his inventory.  He would like to start selling fabrics and also to increase the number of his employees to two.  His goal is to be able to contribute to the improvement of his family's diet. 

In the future, Papa Moussa would like to better develop his commercial activity and buy a larger store, so that he can completely satisfy the demand from his customers.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a 25-year-old married woman.  She supports her family of five by running a cafe.  She has run the business for three years, and earns 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) per month. 

Tabitha has asked for a loan of 15,000 KES from KADET LTD. She wants to use the loan to buys stocks for her business, for example wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. 

With the anticipated increased profit from her business, Tabitha plans to replay the loan.  She hopes for a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase cooking fat, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Emmanueline

texts.en:
Emmanueline is a 38-year-old married woman with three children.  She lives in Kasese, Uganda, and has worked hard as a health information assistant for six years.

Emmanueline's personal goals are to educate her children up to university level, and to open up a drug store to supplement her salary. She is planning to use this loan to pay for school fees for her children.  She has previously borrowed money for the same purpose.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 46 years old, married with four children aged between five and 15 years old. He slaughters livestock and sells the meat in Kapsabet town. He has operated the business for nine years earning an income of 60,000 KES monthly. He has requested his third loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to pay his children's school fees.  

The profits he gets from his business will be used to repay the loan and the remaining profits will be ploughed back into his business. His dream is to educate his children and prosper in his business.

loans.use: To pay his children's school fees.

loans.name: Hindu

texts.en: Hindu is a single mother of three children and two of her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She has been in this clothing business for three years, selling to all categories of people but at retail at the market. She works six days a week both on a wholesale and retail basis.  Her major business challenge includes thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to import used clothes to sell on a wholesale basis only. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 33 years old. She is married with four children. The oldest is 16 years old and the youngest is 11 years old. Her husband is a driver. She has been in business for seven years selling meat. She wants a loan to buy more meat to sell. With the profit, she will pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more meats for sale.

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is a 62-year-old widow, with two grown-up children aged 21 and 27 years old.  She has been in business for ten years, selling food locally.  

Floride has asked for a loan to buy more cabbages to sell. With the anticpated increased profits she will generate, Floride plans to add to her savings.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale, such as cabbages.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is from Tiribe. She has her own home, with children. She is a very hard-working, responsible and very honest woman. Her husband earns a living selling various products. 

Her dream has always been to have a well-supplied general store in order to be able to generate more income and thus be able to have a better quality of life for her and her whole family. With her effort, work and dedication, she succeeded, reaching her goals without any type of problem. Today, she has the shop she dreamed of and she is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase extra goods including drinks, food products, vegetables and milk. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, food products, vegetables, milk and more.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 53-year-old hardworking married man with nine kids. He lives in Msambweni, Kenya with her family in his own home. He works selling clothing for women, men, and children and has a variety of shirts, dresses, pants, and other items. He has had this business for 10 years and this has given him lots of sales experience, allowing him to obtain better income. He sells his goods by traveling to different neighborhoods, and from home. He has built up a good customer base, and people choose him as he always has what they need at affordable prices and sells quality products with excellent customer service.

He has requested a loan of Ksh 30,000 to buy materials and tape measures. He is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy materials and tape measures.

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is married with five children, three of whom go to school. She has been running a business selling all sorts of used clothes for five years. She works seven days a week, and moves every day to sell to a different area. Mastula generates extra income by working in a beauty salon. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to electricity but not piped water. 

Mastula has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO so she can buy more bales of used clothes. Her main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Mastula dreams of getting a permanent premises for her business, and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She has a fish-selling business and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of fish. She sells fish on a wholesale basis only. She works at the market six days a week. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  She aspires to own a delivery van to improve the ease of transportation and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 29 years old, married and a mother of one child. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan of KES 40,000 to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on to sell to her customers.

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her child's school fees as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her business such as dresses, blouses, trousers, shirts and so on to sell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is from Azatan village of Shirak region. She is 48 years old and lives with her husband, son and father-in-law. 
Together with her husband and son, Hasmik is involved in agriculture. She cultivates wheat and potato and does her best to gather a good harvest. Her husband and son sell the gathered harvest in the local market and get income which is hardly enough for covering family's costs.
Realizing that the profit from the agricultural business is very important for the family, Hasmik has applied for this loan.
With the help of the loan Hasmik plans to purchase potato seeds and expand the potato cultivation business. This will help her to make more income and ensure a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds.

loans.name: Murtaz

texts.en: Murtaz is 60 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 32-year-old son in Tkibuli district, West Georgia. Murtaz is a joiner and gets orders to produce different kinds of wooden materials with his own sawing installation. In addition, he is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. His wife produces cheese and sells it at local market. At the same time, they have a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees are grown. Murtaz sells the harvested nuts locally. Each member of the family works hard to insure a good harvest. Murtaz requested a loan for purchasing piglets and building a shed for the piglets. He plans to expand the livestock and increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they will improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and to build a shed for them

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a thirty-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has worked as a community development officer for four years, working with children, mothers and HIV-infected people.  He also has a motorcycle transport business for additional income. 

Benson has applied for a loan to pay for school fees for himself. He hopes to have a high-paying job after graduating, despite the challenges of low income and heavy work load which limit his ability to concentrate on his studies.

loans.use: to pay school fees for himself.

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en:
Janviere is a 36-year-old married woman with three children, aged between one and seventeen years old.  She has worked for thirteen years, and her husband is her partner in business. 

Janviere has asked for a loan to buy more bananas for sale.  She plans to add to her savings with the anticipated increased profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a 46-year-old married woman with four children, living in Kasese, Uganda.  For ten years, she has been selling local brew, and she has been able to pay for school fees for her children with the proceeds.  She has applied for a loan to buy more local brew for resale. 

Justine is a good mother, and despite her low income she dreams of educating her children up to university level.  For herself, her goal is to own a bar selling a variety of spirits.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 27-year-old married woman with two children aged one month and four years old.  Her husband is a mechanic. 

Sarah has been in business for five years selling food.  She has asked for a loan to buy more bananas, potatoes and beans.  She plans to add to her savings with the anticipated increase in profits from the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, potatoes and beans for sale.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is from Tiribe. She's a merchant and the owner of a food market. She has been doing this work for more than ten years and she has become very well known among the customers who go there.

Mwenda's a person with a lot of enthusiasm who likes to get ahead. That's why she works so hard. She works from very early in the morning to prepare the dishes she sells, and she returns home late at night.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes. This is what she most needs and uses every day.

She's grateful for this opportunity, because with it she's making progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages and supplies for her dishes.

loans.name: Hripsik

texts.en:
Hripsik has been involved in agriculture for the last ten years. She is 27-years-old and married with four children. Despite her young age, Hripsik, together with her husband, works hard to sustain her children. She breeds cattle, cultivates wheat and grows apricot and peach trees. Her livestock currently includes six cows and nine bulls.
The main income for this family comes from their agricultural business, so Hripsik would like to expand it. 
She has applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation. 
The loan is very important for Hripsik to gather a higher income and ensure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old, married and a mother of two children. She sells fruits and vegetables as well as fish in Malindi for a living where she earns a monthly income of about 5,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She has applied for a loan of  20,000 KES to purchase more stocks of fish and vegetables to sell.

Mary intends to continue growing her business and hopes that one day she will come to own a well established retail shop in the area.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to his M-PESA business float.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en: Rahim, 50 years old, is married and has two children, aged 18 and 16. He is the only income earner in his family. Rahim is a tailor with 30 years’ experience. He repairs vehicle seats and sews new covers for seats. Rahim is a very cautious, responsible and respectable man among his clients. His plan is to get new sewing machines to improve the quality of the work and to expand his business. Rahim has requested a loan to purchase thread and other materials required for tailoring.

loans.use: To purchase thread and other materials required for tailoring.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah, 30 years old, is married and supports four members of her family. Her children are aged between 1 and 7 years old. For the past year, Hannah has been preparing and selling soup, earning an income of KES 10,000. Hannah is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD to purchase bone marrow and other ingredients to prepare soup for sale. She will use the profits she earns to repay the loan. Hannah hopes to educate her children to greater heights.

loans.use: To purchase bone marrow to prepare soup for sale

loans.name: Nayil

texts.en:
Nayil and his wife have two children, aged 9 and 13. They both work as teachers at a local school. Six years ago, they decided to become farmers in their spare time to raise additional income. They raise sheep and cattle to resell, and also sell byproducts such as milk and wool. With the extra income, they are able to send their children to school and pay for their fees. Nayil is determined to send them to school because he wants his children to have more opportunities to achieve their goals.

Nayil has applied to VFAC for a loan so that he can buy furniture for his home. He has long wanted to be able to furnish is home, and is hoping that is loan will be approved.  

Nayil thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To furnish his home.

loans.name: Medza

texts.en:
Medza lives in Tiribe, Kenya, and earns a living buying and selling chickens. She sells them to restaurants, diners and other shops. 

Thanks to the high quality of her chickens, her business is starting to make headway. However, Medza is struggling to make enough money through her work to get ahead and help her family.

Medza has applied for a loan to buy more chickens, to keep up her supply and stay in business. Hew goal is to own and manage a shop one day.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno is a merchant who makes a living selling mainly fish, fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 10 years from her place in a popular market in Tiribe, where she sells fresh products to her customers every day. Luvuno is a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day from very early in the morning when she begins her work. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fish, fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fish, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kedoshi Group

texts.en:
Kedoshi is a group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District represented by Felda. The group has six women and six men. Felda is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her on credit consisting of the necessary materials to plant a ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum. Felda joined One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2013 season. Felda joined One Acre Fund so that she could access the best input prices and grow enough food for the family. 

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Felda was only able to harvest a 1/2 bag of maize per 1/4 acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest four bags per 1/4 acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy a cow. Felda’s group members will each receive input loans of a ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for six acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is from Tiribe. She’s married and living with her husband. She owns a cosmetic store and sells general items at home. She’s a very hardworking, very honest woman. 
Her dream had always been to have a store and to sell beverages and general merchandise and now thanks to her work and effort she has her own store. Umazi is requesting the loan to expand part of her living room in order to stock more products, meet customer demand and increase daily sales to thus continue helping her family.

loans.use: to enlarge her store and to purchase cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en:
Humphrey is 58 years old, married, and a father of five children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling water to Malindi residents. He earns a monthly profit of KES. 5,050. 

He was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and he is applying for his second loan of 30,000 KES to purchase a bigger water tank which is capable of holding more litres of water to sell to his clients.

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for school fees for his last born child. Humphrey's goal for the future is to own a well-established water depot in the area, so as to help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger water tank which is capable of holding more litres of water to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en:
Zuma is 31 years old. He is married to Sudi Kazungu and they have five children. He lives with her family in Samburu, Mombasa, Kenya. He is very hard-working to ensure he can reach his goals.
He owns a charcoal stall where he buys and sells firewood and charcoal, a business he has been doing for four years, hence he has gained a wide variety of customers. He is requesting a loan amounting of KES 50,000 to buy sacks of charcoal and firewood in stock.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoals and firewood in stock.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is 34 years old, married, and a mother of one child. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling cosmetics in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 7,350. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her first loan of KES. 20,000, to buy additional stock for her business such as hair weaves, beauty makeup, nail polish, and deodorant to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her child's school fees as well as expand her business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 33 years old. He is married and has been blessed with two school-going children.

Charles operates a retail shop which sells cycle spares within Katito town. He has been doing this business for the last five years. He comfortably makes a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings. He is taking out his third loan with KADET Ltd, which he will use to increase the value of his stock by purchasing more spare parts. He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business into a wholesale. His dream is to become a well known spare parts dealers in Katito region so that he will become a well known businessman.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sale

loans.name: Jose Heliodoro

texts.es:
José, 52 años de edad, originario de Estelí, actualmente vive en Managua, acompañado, padre de 9 hijos, mayores de edad, todos son independiente, de oficio comerciante, se  dedica  al negocio de pulpería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio con capital propio, vendiendo mercadería  variada de forma ambulante en los diferentes barrios de la capital, luego con el tiempo surgió la idea de establecer una pulpería en su casa , para apoyar a su esposa y de esta manera evitar que ella saliera a la calle a vender ,el cual se siente satisfecho porque este negocio le genera ganancias  a diario, ya que cuenta con clientes fijos, en el negocio recibe el   apoyo de su esposa quien le administra su  pulpería, mientras que el sale a vender a la calle su mercadería, a el le gustaría comercializar  sus productos en el Mercado ya que es una zona muy  buena para el comercio, sus expectativas es seguir ampliando su negocio. 
José  en esta ocasión esta solicitando el financiamiento para comprar  abanicos, planchas, licuadoras y granos basicos como arroz, frijoles y azucar. ya que el estima el crédito le ayudaría a comprar toda la mercadería variada que aun no tiene en existencia y los productos mas solicitados y  cumplir con los encargos de cada uno de sus clientes, uno de sus planes futuros es seguir creciendo en su negocio, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: José, 52 years old, is from Estelí and currently lives in Managua. He is the father of 9 children, all now independent adults. He works in his store which he started with his own money, initially by selling various goods from a cart in different neighborhoods in the capital. After some time he had the idea of establishing a store in his home, in order to support his wife and avoid having to go out to the streets to make his sales. He is very pleased that this business is now earning him money every day, as he has many regular clients. He receives help from his wife who manages the shop while he goes out to sell his goods on occasion in one of the city's main Markets, which is a very commercial zone good for business. He hopes to continue growing his business, and at this time is asking for a loan to buy fans, irons, blenders and basic ingredients such as rice, beans, and sugar. He expects this loan to help him buy a few items to sell that he does not yet have in stock, as well as to buy some of the most requested goods and comply with his clients' needs. By increasing his sales, he will be able to continue to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy fans, irons, blenders, and basic ingredients such as rice, beans, and sugar

loans.name: Mwero

texts.en: Mwero is from Tiribe branch and has two children. He has a wholesale stall where he sells fried fish. Thanks to his work, he is able to help his children attend school and pay for all the household needs. He is a dedicated person who has demonstrated that he works hard to meet his obligations. Mwero is asking for this loan to buy sacks of fish so that he can continue working to meet his goals.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine runs a farm. Her farm currently includes 3 cows, 2 lamb, 3 little pigs and 30 chickens. She also cultivates wheat and barley. 
Narine lives in Goghhovit village of Shirak region with her husband (in the photo) and children. 
Narine's husband Aram helps her to run a farm and sustain the family. But unfortunately this agricultural income is hardly enough for covering the family's basic needs. So, Narine has applied for this loan to pay for 6 heifers, 5 little pigs and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help her to gather more income and cover daily costs of the family.
The loan is very important for Narine to be able to give her children appropriate living conditions and secure better life for them.

loans.use: to pay for 6 heifers, 5 little pigs and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 27 years old. For the last 15 years, he has earned a living by selling new clothes, dressmaking supplies and household goods in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of 11,400 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Antony was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer, and he is applying for his second loan. This loan of 40,000 KES is to buy additional stock of shower cups, utensil trays, water buckets and basins to sell to his clients. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his niece's school fees. Antony's goal for the future is to own a well established retail store in the area, so as to help improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of shower cups, utensil trays, water buckets and basins

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan , de oficio agricultor , 51 años de edad, casado padre de 6 hijos de los cuales 1 esta a cargo de el y el resto viven independiente , sus estudios solo llegaron hasta la primaria . El es habitante de una pequeña comarca llamada el Empalme en las afueras de Boaco, desde muy joven se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos oficio que adquirió por tradición, su  situación de pobreza no le permitió seguir estudiando pues  no tenía el apoyo de nadie tuvo que trabajar para poder comer. Actualmente además de cultivar maíz, vende elotes y leche,  las actividades agrícolas las realiza con un hijo y un mozo. Sus ingresos lo ha invertido en compra de ganado y poco a poco ha comprado un motor de riego el cual ha sido de muy útil para facilitar el proceso de riego para sus cultivos.  Su producción de maíz lo vende en su misma comunidad. 
Requiere el crédito para comprar terneros y pagar mano de obra para limpieza de terreno para el nuevo ciclo de siembra de granos básicos. Tiene pensado seguir invirtiendo en la crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Juan, an agricultural officer, is 51 years old, married, with six children. One of his children still lives at home, the rest are living independently. He has a primary school education. He lives in a small town called Empalme, which is located on the outskirts of Boaco. Since he was young he has been growing basic grains. He learned this skill from his parents. Because of his poor economic situation he wasn’t able to continue with his studies. He didn’t have support from anyone and he had to work in order to eat. In addition to growing corn he sells beans and milk. He has been working in agriculture since he was a child and a young man. With his earnings he buys cattle and little by little he has been installing irrigation. Irrigation is very useful as it lowers the risk to his crops. He sells his corn in his community.
He would like this loan in order to buy calves and to pay for workers to clear his land for the new corn crop cycle. He would like to continue investing in the raising of young cattle.

loans.use: to buy calves and to pay for workers to prepare his land.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, una humilde campesina, de 49 años de edad, casada, 5 hijos , se dedica a la siembra de frijol , maíz y crianza de ganado , en la  comarca el Bálsamo en las afueras de Boaco, sus estudios a duras penas llegaron hasta la primaria. 
Sus padres se dedicaban a la ganadería y agricultura, ella creció con esta actividad, siendo el único oficio que le ha servido para sobrevivir. Su esposo se dedica a lo mismo ambos luchan por sacar adelante a su familia, trabajan sembrando maíz, frijol y dedicándose a la crianza de ganado. El terreno donde siembran se lo heredo su padre y ha sabido aprovecharlo pues es la fuente de donde comen su familia y sobreviven a diario. 
Esta necesitando el financiamiento para comprar melaza, gallinaza(comida concentrada para ganado) , al tener almacenado concentrado al por mayor podrá alimentar a sus animales durante el verano que es la época donde la producción de pasto es escaza y necesita tener a sus animales en buenas condiciones y sanos. 
Uno de sus proyectos es mejorar su humilde vivienda y comprar tierra para heredarla a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Catalina, 49 years old and married with 5 children, lives in the countryside. She is very humble with only a primary education, and works in the field cultivating beans and corn and raising cattle (in the region of Bálsamo on the outskirts of Boaco). 

Her parents also worked in agriculture and livestock, so she grew up around these activities. In fact, it is because of this work that she has been able to survive. Her husband also dedicates himself to the field and in doing so both of them work together to get their family ahead. The land that they work was inherited from her father, and she has successfully taken advantage of it to be the source of support for her family. 

Catalina is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy feed for the animals, in order to have a large inventory of food to be able feed them during the summer - the season when grass is scarce and she needs to have her animals in good and healthy condition. 

Catalina hopes to one day improve her humble home, and buy land in order to bequeath to her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her livestock

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Nicodemus, 27 years old, is a single hardworking man living with his parents. He is the bread winner in a family of six since his parents are old and cannot provide for his siblings.
His main source of expenditure is school payments for his siblings. He earns his living from the business of buying and selling goats.
He has been a member for the last four years and has shown a character of responsibility and hard work. He has requested a loan amounting to KES. 40,000 to pay school fees for his siblings. He is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his siblings.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.es:
La señora Petrona esta casada, tiene 55 años de edad, cursó los grados de educacion primaria, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típica, cortes, guipiles, blusas, fajas y otros, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo, hasta el momento lleva  30 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su espso quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo }el cual lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para la venta, compra de cortes, guipiles, suéteres, blusas, fajas, etc. Espera en el futuro su negocio crezca y tenga un local de venta. Las demás integrantes se dedica al comercio, artesanía, atención a tienda, y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
The borrower Petrona is married, 55 years old, has a primary education and has 8 children - two of whom are studying. She works selling typical clothing, including skirts, blouses, and other items. She started this business with the support of her husband, and now has 30 years of experience. Her husband helps her support their family by working in agriculture. 

Petrona is part of a lending group, and is now asking for this loan in order to buy more merchandise to sell. She would like to buy skirts, traditional blouses, sweaters, belts, etc. She hopes in the future that her business will grow and she will have a store from which to sell her merchandise. The other members of the group work in business, handicrafts, and animal raising.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Luisa Lucrecia

texts.es: Luisa una mujer emprendedora de 41 años casada con 04 hijos, 03 de ellos dependientes. Hace más de 10 años que la señora  Luisa trabaja como cobradora de bus. Decidió trabajar  con el fin de aportar en su hogar. Gracias a sus arduo trabajo  a podido comprar su propio terreno.  Su siguiente meta es de construir su vivienda y ver a sus hijos profesionales. Solicito el crédito para los gastos de salud de su padre, ya que se encuentra delicado de salud. Luisa agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada y se compromete a seguir trabajando con responsabilidad. Luisa de   41 años de edad es casada y tiene 04 hijos,  03 de ellos aún dependiente.
texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking woman, 41 years of age, and is married with four children (three of whom are minors). She works as a fare collector on a bus in order to support her family. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to buy her own piece of land. Her next goal is to construct a home and help her children study and have professional careers. 

Luisa is asking for this loan in order to pay for her father's medical expenses, as his health is currently suffering. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the help provided, and she promises to continue to work to cover all of her responsibilities.

loans.use: to pay health expenses

loans.name: Agripinah

texts.en:
Agripinah is a married woman. She has a pharmacy in the market and has been doing this work since 2011. She began this work with the help of her husband who is a businessman.

She is a person who has always tried hard, and thanks to her job she is able to grow and have the necessary means to be able to help her family. Agripinah has a large customer base and every day she has more orders.

She needs this loan for the purchase of more medicine in order to restock and have everything that her customers need.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio, de 54 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Maruja y uno de sus 6 hijos: Analí, a la que cuida en la casa que compró hace 25 años.  
Él es un hombre trabajador, todas las mañanas desde las primeras horas del día se dirige a trabajar con mucho ahínco en sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembra hace 30 años. Comenta que gracias a sus padres, posee extensas áreas agrícolas en plena carretera central donde existe trasporte público e interprovincial. Este apoyo hace que pueda negociar y mantener sus sembríos con mayor facilidad. “Con todo el dinero que pude juntar compré 2 autos con los que realizo trasporte público gracias a mis hijos mayores, quienes administran y manejan los autos”, afirma con gran alegría, pues siempre quiso trabajar con sus hijos, asimismo Anastacio tiene trabajos eventuales como chofer trasladando alimentos en todo el país, aprovecha este trabajo para poder trasladar también su propia cosecha. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Anastacio, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para su próxima siembra. Además de el pago de conversión a gas del quipo de su auto, de esta manera espera ahorrar en combustible, ya que no utilizará petróleo.
texts.en:
54-year-old Anastacio is a hard-working man. He lives with his wife Maruja and one of his six children: Analí, whom he cares for in the house he bought 25 years ago.

He is a hard-working man; every day he goes early in the morning to work hard on the land which he has been sowing for thirty years. He comments that thanks to his parents, he owns extensive agricultural land around the middle of the central highway where there is public transportation and long-distance buses. This support makes it easier for him to trade, as well as to maintain his sown fields. "With all the money I could get together, I bought two cars which I can use for public transportation thanks to my older children, who manage the cars", he states with great happiness since he always wanted to work with his children. Anastacio has casual work as a driver, transporting food throughout the country. He takes advantage of this job to also transport his own harvested crops.

This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, whose collaboration he is waiting for in order to continue with his goals. He again promises to comply with his loan repayments. He likes being part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive.  

Anastacio will invest the money in buying organic fertilizer for the next time he sows crops, as well as in paying for his car to be converted to gas so he can save on fuel as he will no longer be using petrol.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and change his fuel system to gas.

loans.name: Pela

texts.en: Pela is a 22-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows bananas, taro and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Pela has requested a loan to buy new equipment for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Pela hopes to expand her business to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, spades, shovels, and gloves.

loans.name: Maele

texts.en: Maele is a 31-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams, and other items to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Maele has requested a loan to get new equipment for her farming. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Maele hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a wheel barrow, shovels, fertilizer, and gloves.

loans.name: Chongwa

texts.en:
Chongwa says that thanks to the previous loan that he received from Kiva, he was able to provide better products to his customers and the business was able to grow sufficiently. He is very grateful for this support.

He is once again interested in asking for further assistance. He wants to invest again in the store to be able to stock it with more products and a variety of supplies such as chicks, feed and other supplies. He is very grateful for the new opportunity that he is receiving and it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Mesepa

texts.en: Mesepa is a 65-year-old married woman with 9 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Mesepa has requested a loan to buy more supplies such as bush knives, a wheelbarrow, gloves, and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Mesepa hopes to save for the improvement of her family and children.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a wheelbarrow, gloves, and shovels.

loans.name: Masina

texts.en: Masina is a 52-year-old woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Masina has requested a loan to buy barbed wire, timber, cattle food and a small water tank. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Masina hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, timber, cattle food and a water tank.

loans.name: Foai

texts.en: Foai is a 21-year-old married woman with one child. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. Foai has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed spray, a chainsaw, knives, etc., for her plantation. Foai will spend her profits to build a small flea market in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed spray, a chainsaw, knives, etc.

loans.name: Tapunuu

texts.en: Tapunuu is 54 years old and married with seven children. She would like to start a small business selling dresses and other items. In order to do this, Tapunuu needs a loan to buy clothing materials, a roller and a new sewing machine for her business. She hopes to use her profits to save for her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials, a roller and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Teleofa

texts.en: Teleofa is 58 years old and married with one child. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Teleofa needs a loan to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe and spade for her plantation. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe and spade

loans.name: Afif

texts.en:
Afif is a 53-year-old married man, and father of two children. 

He has been selling fruit and vegetables since 1998. He is a hard worker and is well known in his area, with his good reputation and special products and prices.

Afif is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to  increase his merchandise with fruit and vegetables specially requested by his customers. 

This is Afif's twelfth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. He has a good repayment history. His previous loans helped him to develop his business and  to improve his social living. He hopes to be able to reply to his customers requests and fulfil his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with specially requested fruit & vegetables.

loans.name: Simaima

texts.en: Simaima is 44 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates an elei printing system. She has two years of experience in this line of business. Simaima needs a loan to buy a new sketch board, clothing materials, spray, a roller and paints. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a new sketch board, clothing materials, spray, a roller and paints

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock for her business of dealing in bedding products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 34 year old married woman with six children. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. 

She catches and sells fish in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Telesia needs a loan to buy new equipment. She plans to use her profits to help educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fishing equipment, such as spears, fishing nets, and a canoe.

loans.name: Ankadignongonye Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Ankadignongonyé, composé de femmes mariées et d’une veuve, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, commune de Marka Coungo,  Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de charbon de bois et des friandises.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Ankadignongonyé sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente NAGNINI, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter des condiments (un sac de sel, trois paquets de cube Maggi, deux kilogrammes d’oignon) avec les revendeurs de Marka Coungo pour ensuite revendre sur place et à la maison dans le village.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de famille et une partie est réinvestie dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The Ankadignongonyé group is made up of married women and one widow who have an average age of 43 and, on average, 4 children, and all live in extended traditional families in the village of Massoukou, Marka Coungo commune, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali). They got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and friendships. They sell condiments, charcoal and sweets. The women of the Ankadignongonyé group are on their 4th group loan.

Nagnini, the first person sitting on the left of the picture, plans to buy condiments (a bag of salt, 3 packets of Maggi stock cubes, 2 kilos of onions) from the resellers of Marka Coungo, so that she can resell them there and from her home in her village. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 10 000 francs, part of which will be used to take care of the family's needs and part of which will be reinvested in her condiments business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya, composé de femmes mariées et une veuve, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, commune de Marka Coungo, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de friandises (à base de haricot), de beurre de karité et de riz paddy.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Danaya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente KOUDEDJA, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 50 kilos de haricot et deux kilos de beurre de karité afin de préparer des friandises qui seront vendues pendant les jours de foire aux abords de la route, aux femmes et aux hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of married women and one widow. They have an average age of 36 and, on average, 3 children and all live in extended traditional families in the village of Massoukou, Marka Coungo commune, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and friendships. They sell sweets (made from beans), shea butter and paddy rice. The women of the Danaya group are on their 4th group loan.

Koudedja, standing in the middle of the back row in the picture, plans to buy 50 kilos of beans and 2 kilos of shea butter so that she can make sweets which will be resold at the roadside during market days, to women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 11 000 francs, part of which will be used to take care of the family's needs and part of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy beans and shea butter.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Composé de femmes mariées les membres du groupe Djekafo, ont en moyenne 30 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de friandises (farine de blé), et du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur troisième prêt.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente DJELIKA, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter dix kilogrammes de la farine de blé et deux litre d’huile qui sera utilisé pour préparer et vendre des friandises pendant les jours de foire au marché de Marka Coungo  femmes et aux hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group is made up of married women with an average age of 30 and, on average, 4 children who all live in extended traditional family settings in the village of Massoukou, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and friendships. They sell snacks (made using wheat flour) and charcoal. The women of the Djekafo group are on their 3rd loan.

Djelika, standing on the left in the picture, plans to buy 10 kilos of wheat flour and 2 litres of oil which will be used to make snacks to be sold during market days in Marka Coungo, to women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15 000 francs, part of which will be used to take care of her family's needs and part of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and oil.

loans.name: Sountongnoma Group

texts.fr:
Mme G. Ivone représente le groupe SOUNTONGNOMA. Mariée, elle est mère de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 35ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes a sa charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 16ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Elle veut s’acheter 05 pièces de pagnes et 03 pièces de pagnes bazin.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité. Elle souhaite agrandir son champ d’activité et aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
G. Ivone is the representative of the Sountongnoma group. She is married and the mother of 7 children, the eldest of whom is 35 and the youngest, 12. Two of her children go to school and she is responsible for 2 people. She has been selling pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) for 16 years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are women and men.

G. Ivone would like to buy 5 bolts of pagnes and 3 bolts of damask pagnes. She would like to save her profits so that she can strengthen her business. She wishes to extend her range of business activities and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 5 bolts of pagnes and 3 bolts of damask pagnes.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Benkadi est un groupe composé de femmes qui ont en moyenne 32 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Solomanibougou, commune de Marka Coungo, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de beurre de karité, de condiments, du lait et de gâteaux.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.
La cliente  CHITAN, première personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter dix kilos de beurre de karité pendant les jours de foire au marché de Marka Coungo avec les revendeurs, elle revend au village en petit morceau à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour ses besoins de famille et une partie est réinvestie dans son activité de commerce de beurre de karité.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group made up of women with an average age of 32 and, on average, 3 children and who all live in extended, traditional family settings in the village of Solomanibougou, Marka Coungo commune, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships, and friendships. They sell shea butter, condiments, milk and cakes. The women of the Benkadi group are on their 6th group loan.

Chitan, standing on the far right in the picture, plans to buy 10 kilos of shea butter from the resellers during the market days in Marka Coungo. She resells it in small pieces in her village to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 10 000 francs, part of which will be used to take care of her family's needs and part of which will be reinvested in her shea butter-selling business.

loans.use: to buy shea butter.

loans.name: Bitechi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Bitechi, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Solomanibougou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers de boutique, de condiments et du charbon de bois. Les femmes du groupe Bitechi sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des articles divers de boutique, des condiments et du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
La cliente  FATOUMATA BAH, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter vingt cinq kilos de sucre, sept paquets de thé, cinq sachets de lait en poudre avec les fournisseurs de Marka Coungo, elle revend en détail au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce d’articles divers de boutique.
texts.en:
The Bitechi group is made up of married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 3 children and who all live in extended, traditional family settings in the village of Solomanibougou, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and friendships. They sell various shop items, condiments and charcoal. The women of the Bitechi group are on their 6th group loan, which will be used to buy various shop items, condiments and charcoal.

Fatoumata Bah, sitting first on the left in the picture, plans to buy 25 kilos of sugar, 7 packets of tea and 5 sachets of powdered milk from the suppliers in Marka Coungo. She resells her merchandise in her village to a retail clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs, part of which will be used to take care of her family's needs and part of which will be reinvested in her retail business.

loans.use: to buy various articles for her shop.

loans.name: Fokognouma Group

texts.fr:
Fokognouma est un groupe composé de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’encens, de friandises (farine de haricot).                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Fokognouma sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente SALI, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter cinq kilogrammes de < mognonkisseni >, un bidon d’eau de Cologne destiné pour la fabrication de l’encens qui sera vendu pendant les jours de foire au marché de Marka Coungo aux femmes et aux hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 5.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Fokognouma is a group consisting of married women, who are on average 33 years old, have 3 children and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Massoukou, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell incense and sweets (bean flour).

The women of Fokognouma group are on their fourth loan in solidarity.

The client Sali, the second person from the left, plans to buy five kilograms of 'mognonkisseni' and one can of eau de Cologne to make incense which will be sold during the days of the fair at the market of Marka Coungo to women and men. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 5,000 FCFA which will be used for the needs of the family and partly reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make incense.

loans.name: Wilikateme Group

texts.fr:
Wilikateme est composé de femmes mariées et de veuve qui ont en moyenne 43 ans, 4 enfants et qui vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Massoukou, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habits et d’articles divers de boutique.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Wilikateme sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des tissus et des articles de boutique.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente SITAN, première personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter quelques pièces de wax avec les revendeurs de Marka Coungo qui seront vendu pendant les jours de foire au marché et au village sur place à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Wilikateme consists of married and widowed women who are on average 43 years old, have 4 children and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Massoukou, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell clothing and various boutique items.

The women of Wilikateme group are on their fourth loan in solidarity which will be used to buy fabric and boutique items.

The client Sitan, the first person from the left, plans to buy several pieces of wax pagnes [colorful African fabric] from the resellers in Marka Coungo which will be sold during the days of the fair at the market and in the town on the spot to a clientele made up of women and men.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA which will be used for the needs of the family and partly reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [colorful African fabric].

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Heremakono, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Zebougou, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales et de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Heremakono sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente OULEMATOU, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter 250 kilos céréales (riz local et mil) avec les revendeurs sur place et de Massigui pendant les jours de foire, elle revend en détail au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de céréales.
texts.en:
The group Heremakono is made up of married women who are on average 38 years old, have 4 children and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Zebougou, commune of Massigui, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali).

They met through family, neighborhood and friendship ties. They sell cereals and do catering.

The women of the Heremakono group are on their sixteenth loan in solidarity.

The client Oulematou, the person in the middle in the row of those standing, plans to buy 250 kgs of cereals (local rice and mil [African cereal]) from the resellers on the spot and in Massigui during the days of the fair. She resells retail in the town to a clientele made up of women and men.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA which will be used for the needs of the family and partly reinvested in her business selling cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Tuamafa

texts.en: Tuamafa is a 23-year-old single lady with no child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, baking soda and a new frying pan. In the future, Tuamafa hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, baking soda, pots, tongs, and other items.

loans.name: Salefu

texts.en: Salefu is 75 years old and married with 10 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, baking soda, pots, tongs, and other items. In the future, Salefu hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, baking soda, pots, tongs, and other items.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Wanting to provide quality products at reasonable prices, Man opened his own herbal retail store in Chinatown in New York City in 2011. His passion and experience, gained while living in Hong Kong before moving to the U.S. 17 years ago, allowed him to supply his local New York community with high-quality, healthful supplements. 

Just a year after he opened his store, however, Hurricane Sandy swept through New York, causing Man's store to lose both electrical power and clients. The storm plunged the store into a blackout for six days, and without electricity, Man lost much of his inventory supply. 

In an effort to make a comeback from the storm, Man began advertising his business through the local newspaper and radio. With this added financial burden, Man has had to reduce his staff to a single part-time employee, taking on the extra hours himself. 

This loan would allow Man to once again restock the inventory lost during the storm, help him recover costs for rent and once again hire a full-time employee. Man hopes to use the remainder of the loan to market his supplement store through printed and radio advertisements to bring in more customers.

loans.use: To rebuild inventory lost during Hurricane Sandy and to hire a full-time employee.

loans.name: Martine

texts.en:
Martine is the proud owner of Re-inc, a company that sells clothing, accessories, and jewelry. With over 10 years of experience in retail and sales, Martine is sure to provide excellent customer service and high-quality brands. 

Martine is seeking a $5,000 loan. The loan will help her to purchase inventory and to create a website. With this loan, Martine will not only continue to provide quality brands but help her expand Re-inc’s services.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and to create a website.

loans.name: Evotia

texts.en: Evotia, an 18-year-old single lady with no children, would like to start growing taamu, taro and yams to earn a living. Evotia has requested a loan to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe and spade, etc. for her plantation. She will save her profits for her future children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, axe and spade, etc.

loans.name: Sasa

texts.en: Sasa is 19 years old and married with one child. She plans to start a business selling "freezers", snacks, soap, tinned food and other merchandise. She has requested a loan to buy new stock for her shop. Sasa will use her profits to extend her small business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, "freezers", tinned food, etc

loans.name: Vaimaila

texts.en: Vaimaila is a 48-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing taro, yams, and taamu to earn a living. Vaimaila has requested a loan to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe and spade, etc. Vaimaila will spend her profits to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe and spade, etc

loans.name: Losalina

texts.en:
Loalina is 49 years old and married. She has eight children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years.

Losalina needs a loan to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe a spade, etc., for her plantation. Losalina will use the profits from her sales to save for her children's school fees and to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy a file, knives, chemicals, weed spray, an axe, a spade, etc.

loans.name: Senara

texts.en:
Senara is a 41-year-old married woman with eight children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Senara has requested a loan to buy knives, chemicals, an axe, a spade, etc., and to pay her children's school fees. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2008. With her profits, Senara hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy knives, chemicals, axe, spade, etc.

loans.name: Toe

texts.en: Toe is 28 years old and married with two children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, pumpkins,and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for almost two years. Toe needs a loan to buy seeds, chemicals, pots, fertilizer and a hose for her vegetables garden. Toe will use the profits from her sales to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemicals, pots, fertilizer and a hose for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 45 years old, married and has six children who are all in school. Jessica works very hard to provide for them.

Jessica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store and to repair her store.

Jessica has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Jessica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store and to repair her store.

loans.name: Vaise

texts.en: Vaise is 44 years old and married with eight children. She wants to start a small business making and selling buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, baking soda, pots, and tongs etc. for her business. In the future, Vaise hopes to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, baking soda, pots, and tongs, etc

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, whose previous loan was a big help in her junk shop, as she was able to buy more scrap and recyclable materials. Additionally, it helped in the education of her children. Nida also has a variety store. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their family.

Nida is requesting a new loan for 25,000 PHP loan to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nida hopes that her businesses will grow and that she will soon have her own junk shop. She dreams that her children will finish their studies and that they will have their own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish and pig fattening. Alicia is borrowing PHP 23.000 through NWTF to purchase more bamboo to sell to customers.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo to sell to customers.

loans.name: Rokiatou

texts.fr:
Rokiatou, agée de 30 ans, est une divorcée qui est mère de deux enfants, résidant chez son père avec leurs dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Mancourani II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Rokiatou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des  friperies il y’a plus de quatre  ans. Elle mène son activité au grand marché de Sikasso et souvent de façon ambulante dans la ville de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 1er prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 3 balles de friperie de qualités différentes 
(respectivement: Tee-Shirt, Léger - habits pour enfants-, Draps et Body). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place avec les grossistes avant de les revendre en détail.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Rokiatou is 30 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children.  She lives with her father in a large, traditional extended family in Mancourani II, one of the more populated districts in the city of Sikasso, (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mrs. Rokaitou, after trying many types of work without much success, began selling second-hand clothing about four years ago.  She makes her sales at the main market in Sikasso as well as on foot in Sikasso where she is much in demand by her customers because of the quality of her merchandise.  In order to meet the growing demands of her customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan.

With her loan she plans to buy three loads of second hand clothing of varying quality (t-shirts, light clothing, children’s clothing, sheets and, Draps and Body ).  She buys her merchandise from wholesalers and them sells it at retail.  

She foresees making an average monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA which will be used to increase her working capital, to contribute to family expenses, and to pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
