This is Alma. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and to cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to continuously provide income for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy parts and to cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Liberty hopes that her business will continue to grow and that she will have another branch. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.


When you feel you've had enough, He's never giving up. It's love.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en: Talosaga is 52 years old and married with 10 children. She makes and sells Samoan fine mats to earn a living and has been doing this for 4 years. Talosaga has requested a loan to buy pandanus (palm-like) leaves, a knife, wool, and thread. She plans to use her profits to re-new her house. She joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a knife, wool, thread and pandanus leaves (similar to palm leaves).

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Lenie is 45 years old and lives in D'ban, Calamba. She is married with 2 children. Lenie has a shop that sells grocery items and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional stock to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 9 years.

loans.use: To purchase 20 boxes of groceries and 20 cases of beverages.

loans.name: Jinny

texts.en:
Growing up in Korea as the daughter of a single mother, Jinny always dreamed of owning her own business.  As a young girl, she watched and learned from her entrepreneurial mother, whose curtain business inspired Jinny to one day start her own business.  

In 2002, Jinny traveled across the world alone to pursue schooling in the US.  After earning her degree, she started working in sushi restaurants to learn more about the industry.  As she gained more work experience and knowledge about sushi, she took note of how she wanted to serve sushi differently: with more care, creativity and much more engagement with customers.  

With over 10 years of sushi experience under her belt, Jinny and her husband used their savings to open Sushi Kuchi in July 2012.  The mission of Sushi Kuchi is to create superb, fresh and creative sushi, while creating a welcoming and engaging environment for customers.  What sets Sushi Kuchi apart is Jinny’s joyful and positive attitude.  She always takes the time to speak with her customers and loves welcoming them by name. In less than a year since opening, Sushi Kuchi employs ten people and has become a favorite sushi spot in Pacific Beach, San Diego.   

Jinny is seeking a Kiva loan to help keep her restaurant open during the slow winter months. Having only been open since last July, the restaurant did not have enough time to adequately prepare for this winter.  A $10,000 Kiva loan will enable Jinny to keep her doors open, while allowing her to build a patio and a more attractive storefront, setting Sushi Kuchi apart from the crowd.  This new patio will also allow customers to bring their dogs, making Sushi Kuchi a pet-friendly place.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Jinny from United States

loans.use: to effect renovations to create more visibility and seating.

loans.name: Ramiriza Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Ramiriza est composé de 27 femmes et 7 Hommes. Sur la photo, deux membres du groupe (Goduile et Anastasie )étaient malades .Elles ont été remplacées par leurs maris respectifs.
Denise est la représentante du groupe  Ramiriza et   habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a   42 ans et est mariée  à Isidore, ensemble ils ont  2 enfants,  le cadet a 17 ans et l’aîné  18,  tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce d’habits depuis 20 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait avoir un grand capital de 1000000 de francs burundais et voir ses enfants terminer les études.
texts.en:
The Ramiriza group is made up of 27 women and 7 men.  When the photo was taken, two of the group members (Goduile and Anastasie) were sick.  They were replaced by their husbands in the photo.  

Denise is the featured borrower of the Ramiriza group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 42 years old and married to Isidore.  The couple have two children.  Their youngest is 17 and their eldest is 18.  They are both in school.  Denise has been selling clothing for 20 years.

This is Denise's 12th loan from Turame.  She will use her Kiva loan to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing to re-sell so that she can earn more money.

In the future, Denise would like to have 1,000,000 Burundian francs in capital and see her children complete their education.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a lot of clothing to re-sell so that she can earn more money

loans.name: Iupeli

texts.en: Iupeli is 53 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for 5 years. Iupeli has requested a loan to buy foam cups, cordials, sugar, a cooler and a freezer. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Iupeli will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, cordials, sugar, a cooler and a freezer.

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en: Pelenatete  is 45 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for five years. Pelenatete has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, plastic bowls and baking powder. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Pelenatete will pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, plastic bowls, and baking powder,.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 52 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Remedios has been farming sugarcane for nine years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 49, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Celso, a carpenter, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php16,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Lilia hopes that her store will grow and that she will have more loyal customers. She dreams to give her children a good education and a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is married with 2 children. She is 64 years old and lives in the Philippines. Perla is a farmer and raises chickens and pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. She has requested a loan to purchase feeds and supplies for her livestock. Perla has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and other supplies for her chickens and pigs.

location.town: Calamba - Bagacay, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Chier

texts.en:
Chier, with her commitment and hard work, is eager to go far in her farming business and is very passionate about supporting her family. She is 51 years old, married, and blessed with three grown up children. Only the last born child still relies on her income. 

Farming is the sole source of Chier's income, which she utilizes to meet the daily necessities of her family. She has been in this field for more than 30 years. Adding to her income from the rice paddy, another main income has been created by her husband providing transportation service with his motorcycle linked with a trailer, which can be loaded with around 20 passengers for a one-way trip from their doorsteps to a local market, or back from the market to their houses. He is able to generate approximately 10.00 USD per day. 

From their house in a small village of the Prey Chor district, Chier’s husband wants to provide motorbike repair service as his supplementary business for extra income. However, he doesn’t have enough capital to buy repair tools to make this business possible. That’s why his wife, Chier, is seeking financial assistance through HKL and Kiva to buy tools for their repair shop. Chier believes that this will enable her husband to generate a better income which will serve their family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools for their repair shop.

loans.name: Pouifi

texts.en: Pouifi is 22 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells elei lavalava (printed sarongs) to earn a living and has been doing this for three years. Pouifi has requested a loan to buy material, brushes and elei board (carved board for making designs). She plans to use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, brushes and elei board (carved board for making designs) to make elei lavalava (printed sarongs).

loans.name: Edilberta's Group

texts.en:
Edilberta is 52 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Edilberta has a business selling ice candy and snacks. She earns about 3,200 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. Edilberta has a requested a loan to purchase construction materials for a house repair.

Edilberta has been a member of PMPC for five years.
  
Edilberta is the leader of a three-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for a house repair.

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
This is Julita. Her previous loan was a big help in her store, for she was able to buy more products needed in her business. Her business has been running for 11 years now, and it keeps on growing. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julita dreams to have her own stall and hopes to become rich. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is a 47-year-old married woman with four children. She gets and sells fresh fish in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business. Filomena needs a loan to purchase all dive-fishing gear for her business. She plans to use her profits to assist her with all her family needs. Filomena has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and dive-fishing gear.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 65 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad. She is married and has one child.

Sylvia has a shop that sells grocery items and other basic household items. She has had this business for 20 years. Sylia requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of grocery items.

Sylvia has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of grocery items

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.ru: Абдулле 58 лет, разведен. Абдулла в качестве основного источника дохода занимается торговлей овощами и фруктами на местном рынке. Начатое 10 лет назад со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) Абдулла имеет очень стабильный и прибыльный бизнес, Абдулла имеет наработанную базу постоянных клиентов. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Абдулла обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на  увеличение товарооборота. Доходы Абдулла планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, чтобы иметь возможность сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Abdulla is fifty-eight and divorced.  His primary source of income is selling fruits and vegetables at the local farmers market.  Having begun ten years ago with starting capital of 5000KGS, Abdulla now has a very stable and profitable business with a steady client base, earning around 15,000KGS per month.  He has turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000KGS so he can further develop his business by increasing sales turnover.  He plans to put his income into growing the business so he'll be able to do repairs on his house.

loans.use: to increase the turnover of goods.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
This is Pelagia, 55, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Agustin, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Pelagia operates a business buying slippers and sandals at wholesale prices and selling them per item with a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices. She also operates a variety store for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Pelagia hopes to buy her own sewing machine used in making sandals and slippers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of slippers and sandals for kids, men and women.

loans.name: Solialii

texts.en:
Solialii is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Solialii has requested a loan to buy equipment and materials needed for her plantation business. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Solialii hopes to improve and expand her current business to get good income for the family.

loans.use: to buy shovels, a wheelbarrow, gloves, and weed killer

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she grows yams and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Telesia needs a loan to buy bush knives, a plant sprayer, shovels, a wheelbarrow and fertilizers to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Telesia will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, a plant sprayer, fertilizers and shovels.

loans.name: Letusia

texts.en: Letusia is a 56-year-old woman who is widowed with seven children. She runs a business of selling goods in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. Letusia has requested a loan to purchase more goods, such as sacks of flour, sacks of sugar, rice, salt, chicken, etc., for her shop. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as rice, sugar, salt, flour, chicken, lollies, snacks, etc., for her shop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 60-year-old woman who is a very friendly, generous and happy person. With 20 years of experience in the business of hog-fattening, she has used these characteristics to easily sell her products. She keeps on making friends with other people. 

Right now, Irene is asking a loan in the amount of 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy vitamins, medicine and feed. These goods are very helpful in making her hogs healthy, and she is hoping that her requested loan will be approved in order to purchase her wished products for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, medicine and feed.

loans.name: Anamaria

texts.en:
Anamaria is 60 years old and married and has 6 children. She has a sewing business that sells good male and female outfits in her community. She has many years of experience in this type of business. 

Anamaria needs a loan to improve the quality of her products. She hopes to use her profits to provide good financial support to her family and kids. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and new fabric

loans.name: Joecelle

texts.en:
Joecelle is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Joecelle is borrowing 22,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Joecelle has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Utalua

texts.en: Utalua is a 54-year-old married woman with 5 children. She makes and sells a variety of food in her community to earn a living. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Utalua needs a loan to improve her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Utalua has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, salt, sugar, snacks, lollies, and ice-cakes

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.ru: Абдуманону 30 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Абдуманон единственный кормилец семьи. Он работает мясником на рынке и в основном продает мясо овец. Абдуманон занимается этой деятельностью уже 5 лет. Он хочет увеличить товарооборот и получить хорошую прибыль. С этой целью Абдуманон берет кредит для закупа овец. За счет прибыли с продажи мяса он намерен расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Abdumanon is thirty and married with three children.  He's the family's sole breadwinner.  He works as a butcher at the farmers market, selling primarily mutton.  He's been in business for five years.  He wants to increase sales turnover and make a good profit, so he is seeking a loan to buy mutton.  He's eager to expand the business by selling the meat and bringing in profits.

loans.use: to buy mutton.

loans.name: Wi

texts.en: Wi is 30 years old, married, and has 2 children. She runs a small business selling ice-cakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Wi has requested a loan to buy sugar and other things to make her ice-cakes. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Wi will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy foam cups, cordials, sugar, freezer, etc.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida, aged 52, is managing her small eatery business in Magapit. Her target market are drivers and passengers because her location is along the highway. She is able to earn about P 1000 a day that usually goes for their daily consumption and allowances.

With the desire to increase her sales capacity, she is requesting a loan amount of P 15,000 to buy meat and vegetables, dishes, glasses and spoons used in her eatery business. She hopes it will contribute a better income to her business in order to save for the emergency and development purposes of their family.

loans.use: to buy meat and vegetables, dishes, glasses and spoons

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en:
Toafa is a 31-year-old married woman with four children. She makes pancakes, and sells them in her community to earn a living. She has five years of experience with this business.

Toafa needs a loan to buy more equipment (flour, sugar, cooking oil, and a new frying pan) to improve her business. 

She plans to use her profits to support her family financially. Toafa has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, and a new frying pan for her pancake-making business.

loans.name: Selau

texts.en:
Selau is a 40-year-old woman who is married, with nine children. She has a small business running bingo games. She has been in this business for three years. 

Selau needs a loan to buy items to be used for bingo. She will use her profits to expand her business. 

Selau joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to purchase items for her bingo business, such as new bingo tokens and bingo paper.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is from the village of Centro 1 in the town of San Guillermo. He is 29 years old and is married to Marcialyn. To raise his family, Ronald is engaged in selling food in the market. He usually sells meat and earns PHP 1,500 a day. He wants to expand his business, and that is why he is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 to buy more meat to sell. He hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Jhoan

texts.en: Jhoan is 36 years old and is engaged in running a small eatery and 'sari-sari' store business. With more than two years of business management, she contributes to a comfortable lifestyle for her family. She wants to continue this good lifestyle through her business.  So she is requesting a loan amount of P 20,000 to buy additional grocery items such as canned goods and soft drinks to stock her business as well as vegetables, meat and rice to cook. She hopes her business will provide a higher income in order to improve their living conditions further.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items such as canned goods, and soft drinks, as well as vegetables, meat and rice to cook

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 55-year-old widowed woman who has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lydia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lydia requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials needed for her tailoring business. Lydia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 39 years old and is married to Reyson, a father who works hard to give their children a good quality of life. To earn a living, Rosalina is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for five years and usually earns about 2,500 PHP per piglet. Rosalina wants to have more piglets to raise. In this regard, she is asking for a loan in the amount of 17,000 PHP to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them. Rosalina hopes to sustain the needs of her hogs as well as her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: A retailing business is the primary source income of Teresita, 63 years of age and happily married with Rosalito. Teresita has been in her business for two years and usually earns about 300 PHP a day. Her income is just enough to cover their daily meals. Right now, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, beverages and condiments to sell. She hopes to obtain her desired loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, beverages and condiments to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa is a 52-year-old widowed woman with 2 grown children. She is from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. Elisa is engaged in a pedicure and manicure business. She has been doing pedicures and manicures for 30 years. Aside from that, Elisa is also into dressmaking. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy materials used for manicures and  pedicures and for dressmaking like cloth, thread and needles. In the future, Elisa would like to invest in other business ventures to improve her status of livelihood at the same time save in preparation for old age.

loans.use: to buy materials used for manicures and pedicures and for dressmaking like cloth, thread and needles

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. She has owned a sari-sari or variety store business for more than 5 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman. Maria is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell in her store like canned goods, rice, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to earn a living and help her husband in meeting the needs of the family.

In the future, Maria dreams of expanding her business, saving money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store like canned goods, rice, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married and works hard to support her family. She has a variety store business in the Philippines, and also earns an income from fingerlings young fish) retail. Lydia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She wants to save enough money so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es un agricultor de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos  en la zona Sur de Costa Rica, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería, Jorge desarrolla la actividad de la siembra de maíz y frijoles desde hace varios años, lo que le genera una única fuente de ingreso familiar, por lo tanto desea expandirse más en cuanto a área de siembra y para ello necesita un préstamo por un millón de colones(¢1.000.000) para comprar semilla de maíz y frijol y así lograr la producción de este producto . Jorge  manifiesta estar muy agradecido porque este es un medio de adquirir financiamiento rápido y con cuotas accesibles para gente trabajadora y que desea superarse.
texts.en:
Jorge is a farmer and is thirty-four years old.  He lives with his wife and two children in the southern part of Costa Rica, where he specializes in growing root vegetables, coffee, corn, beans, and livestock.  Jorge has been developing his work in growing corn and beans for several years; this generates a sole source of income for his family.  

Therefore, he wishes to expand more in terms of a planting area, and for this he needs a loan of one million colones to buy corn and bean seeds, and to thereby continue the production of these crops.  

Jorge says he is very thankful for this means of acquiring rapid financing with accessible payments for hardworking people that want to better themselves.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дильбаре 51 год, не замужем, имеет дочку 28 лет . Дильбар в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении 15 лет занимается продажей хлеб-булочных изделий, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 800 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Дильбар в обороте имеется 98,000 KGS и бизнес приносит около 14,000 сом в месяц.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса и увеличения оборота, Дильбар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Дильбар будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, в будущем планирует сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en: Dilbar is 51 years old. She is unmarried and has a 28-year-old daughter. As the main breadwinner for the family, for the last 15 years she has been selling baked goods. Though she started with only 800 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS), through persistent hard work, she now has 98,000 Som in turnover and her business brings in around 14,000 Som every month. For the purpose of further developing her business and increasing her turnover, Dilbar has approached the company "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan of 70,000 Som. She will re-invest the profit generated by this loan into her business to continue its development, and in the future she plans to renovate her house.

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Mamoudou Garba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mamoudou Garba est âgé de plus de 39 ans marié deux femmes et père de quatre enfants domicilié avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Lafiabougou un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso     (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur   Mamoudou Garba  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès,  s’est initié à cette activité de rôtisseur (vente des moutons et chèvres rôtis) il y’a maintenant dix huit ans. Il dispose d’un point de vente à Mancourani II aux abords du goudron. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier prêt .
Avec ce premier prêt il compte  acheter, 5 moutons, 5 chèvres en provenance des localités environnantes de Sikasso. Ces bêtes seront abattues à des fins de sa rôtisserie et la viande rôtis revendues à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mamoudou Garba is more than 39 years old.  He has two wives and is the father of four children.  He lives with his wives and children in a nuclear family in Lafiabougou, a densely-populated neighborhood of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  

After having run a number of unsuccessful businesses, Mamoudou Garba decided to start a business selling roast meat (sheep and goats).  He has been in this business for 18 years now and has a roadside sales location in Mancourani II.

Mamoudou Garba decided to join Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and request his first loan as he wanted to be able to better satisfy his growing number of customers.  With this first loan, he plans to buy 5 sheep and 5 goats from nearby towns.  These animals will be slaughtered so that he can roast them and sell their meat to a customer base made up of both men and women.  Mamoudou Garba hopes to make a monthly profit of 13,000 francs from this loan.  He will use the money to contribute towards his family expenses, pay the interest on his loan and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Daysi Milagros

texts.es:
Daysi Milagros de  28 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de dos años de edad.orginaria de  Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de  central de la región. En sus ratos libre le gusta mucho disfrutar de actividades recreativas con su pequeño hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de  ingeniería civil.
Gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante,  Daysi tiene por actividad económica una ferretería, desde hace un ano y está ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad. La rutina diaria de Daysi es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus servicios, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con material de ferretería como: zinc, cemento, perlines, clavos, hierro, alambres, pintura, tornillos,  brochas tuvo pvc. Daysi agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
28-year-old Daysi Milagros is married and has a two-year-old son. She comes from Managua, a town which is located in the central area of the region. In her free time she greatly enjoys playing with her little boy. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources she wasn't able to attend college, but she would have very much liked to have studied for a career in civil engineering.
Thanks to her enterprising spirit and her drive to get ahead, Daysi runs a business. She has owned a hardware store for a year and it's located in a specific spot of her town. Daysi's daily routine is working about 10 hours a day offering her services. She runs this business with great pleasure, so that in a not-so-distant future she'll be able to improve her profits. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock up her business with hardware such as zinc, cement, beams, nails, iron, wire, paint, screws, brushes and PVC pipes. Daysi thanks Kiva lenders for the help they provide for people of scarce financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent means of livelihood.

loans.use: to get working capital and stock up her hardware store with merchandise such as zinc, cement, beams, nails, iron, wire, paint, screws and brushes.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en: Armida is 57 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. Armida has applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business. Armida has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Armida would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is 53 years old, married, and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them. Juana runs a general store in the Philippines and has applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, including soap, bread, canned goods and noodles. Juana has been in this business for three years. In the future, Juana would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, including soap, bread, canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Lotu

texts.en: Lotu is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a small business, selling pancakes in her community, as she has been doing for five years. Lotu has applied for a loan to buy flour, sugar and baking powder. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lotu will pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking powder, sugar and cooking oil, as well as a cooking pot, for her pancakes business.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food production business in the Philippines. Narcisa has applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy meat, chicken, and other ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Narcisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, and other ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is 62 years old and has four children. Leonardo is married and has one child currently in school. Leonardo is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonardo has applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Bandjougou Youssouf

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Bandjougou Youssouf est âgé de plus de 34 ans marié et père de quatre enfants domicilié avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Kamalen Sirakoro commune rurale de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Bandjougou Youssouf  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initié à cette activité de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) il y a maintenant sept  ans. Il dispose de son magasin à Kaboïla I.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel, le prêt précédent ayant été correctement remboursé.
Avec ce deuxième prêt il compte  acheter 30 sacs de maïs et 30 sacs de mil en provenance des localités environnantes de Sikasso. Ces marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans son magasin afin d’être revendues à une clientèle composée des détaillants et des chefs de famille.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Bandjougou Youssouf is 34 years old, married, and father of four children. He lives with his wife and children in a large traditional family in Kamalen Sirakoro, a rural commune of Sikasso (third-largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

Bandjougou Youssouf began working in the storage and sale of grains (corn, millet, sorghum) seven years ago, after having worked in many other areas without success. He has a store in Kaboïla I.

He decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in the hope of better satisfying his growing customer base. He is on his second individual loan. The previous loan was correctly repaid.

He plans to use this second loan to buy 30 bags of corn and 30 bags of millet from the surrounding towns of Sikasso. The goods are first stocked in his store, then resold to a clientele made up of retailers and heads of families.

With this loan, he expects to earn a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA, which he will use mainly to support his family and pay the interest of his loan. He will reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée à un Directeur de société, Akouvi est maman de 03 enfants âgés de 11,9 et 07ans qui vont tous à l’école. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint, elle fait le commerce du mais dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé et dans les villes lointaines du pays. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients, elle fait un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des sacs de mais, revendre et tirer plus de profit. Avec le bénéfice, elle veut rouvrir un autre magasin et assurer un avenir meilleur à la famille. Il est à préciser qu’elle est âgée de 37ans et a démarré son en 2008.
texts.en:
Akouvi is married to a managing director and is the mother of three children who are 11, 9 and 7 years old.  All of her children attend school.

In order to help her husband, Akouvi sells corn in a store.  She stocks up in Lomé and in remote towns.  She is requesting her second loan from WAGES so that she can better respond to her customers needs.  She will buy sacks of corn which she will then re-sell and make profit from.  She plans to use her profits to open another store and guarantee her family a better future.  It should be made clear that Akouvi is 37 years old and started her business in 2008.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mbissane

texts.fr: Mbissane est un paysan qui fait des culture de mil et d'arachide sous pluies. Il est père de quatre enfants dont deux sont à l'école primaire. En plus de l'agriculture, il achète chaque année des boeufs qu'il engraisse et revend au bout de 8 mois.Cette diversité d'activité lui permet de prendre en charge les dépenses d'alimentation, de santé, d'habillement et d'autres dépenses diverses de sa famille.Actuellement, il sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter deux bœufs. Son ambition est d'étendre et de moderniser son activité.
texts.en: Mbissane is a farmer who grows millet and groundnuts during the rainy season.  He is the father of four children, two of whom attend elementary school.  In addition to his farming, Mbissane also buys some cows each year which he then fattens and re-sells after 8 months.  This business diversity allows him to meet his family's needs as regards food, health, clothing and other expenses.  He is currently requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy two cows.  His goal is to expand and modernize his business.

loans.use: to buy two cows

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 35ans, Kokouvi est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Pour subvenir à ses propres besoins, il vend depuis 2006 des cartes de recharges qu’il achète à LOME. Il exerce seul son activité et le fait de façon ambulante. Son second crédit qu’il sollicite lui servira à acheter des cartes de recharge pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il veut devenir grossiste et fonder plus tard une famille.
texts.en: Kokouvi is a young, single man of 35 who does not have any dependent children.  In order to cover his own needs, he has been selling pre-paid phone cards since 2006.  He buys his cards in Lomé.  Kokouvi works alone and makes his sales as an itinerant street vendor.  He is requesting his second loan to buy pre-paid phone cards so that he can better meet his customers' needs.  In the future, he would like to become a wholesaler and later start a family.

loans.use: to buy pre-paid phone cards

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, age 51, raises hogs to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business since 2004 and earns approximately PhP 8,000 every four months. She says that the most tiresome part of her work is cleaning the piggery every day. 

She lives with her husband Roberto and their children. Regina dreams of lifting her family from poverty, and this is why she works so hard through her business. 

She wants to provide her pigs with the necessities they require. Therefore, she has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000, which she will use to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs. She is confident that this will make them fit and nourished, bringing her higher sale prices for them at the point of sale. 

Regina hopes to grow her business in order to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Reina

texts.en:
Reina, age 54, operates a sari-sari (general store) business to earn an income. She sells a variety of goods to the people in her community. She and her husband live in Talibon, Bohol, and have a 13-year-old son.

Reina is requesting a loan in order to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap, and toiletries. With this investment, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

In the future, Reina hopes of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль 45 лет, вдова. Айгуль воспитывает 2 сыновей. Сыновья Айгуль активно помогают по хозяйству. Образование у Айгуль среднее, после окончания школы помогала родителям и вышла замуж. Муж скоропостижно скончался. По характеру человек очень хороший, спокойный, целеустремленный. Благодаря стараниям и трудолюбию Айгуль её бизнес очень хорошо развивается. Она занимается откормом и последующей реализацией скота. По мимо этого она занимается продажей молока. Начав этот бизнес в 1986 году с 4,000 KGS сейчас у неё имеется 1 корова, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь 11 голов МРС. Ежемесячный доход Айгуль составляет 9,000 KGS Сом от продажи молока и перепродажи скота. Она обратилась в "Бай Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в размере 45,000 KGS сом.На полученные средства она собирается закупить 2 бычка.  Айгуль поделилась с нами что в будущем планирует отремонтировать дом и улучшить благосостояние семьи
texts.en: Aigul is a 45-year-old widow. She is raising 2 sons who actively help her on the farm. She has a high school education. After graduating, she worked helping her parents before getting married. Her husband passed away suddenly. Aigul is a very kind, calm, and determined woman. Thanks to her efforts and her hard work, her business is developing very well. She fattens and sells cattle, and she also sells milk. Having started this business in 1986 with a sum of only 4,000 Kyrgyzstan Som, she now has 1 cow, 1 calf, 1 horse and 11 head of livestock. Her monthly income from selling cattle and milk is 9,000 Som. Aigul has now approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 45,000 Som to purchase 2 bulls. In the future, she plans to renovate her house and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase 2 bulls

loans.name: Qizlaroy

texts.ru: Кизларой жительница района Хуросон. Ей 43 года. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Её муж и сыновья находятся за рубежом для заработки. Сама Кизларой занимается животноводством. Она покупает крупно-рогатый и мелко-рогатый скот, откармливает их и продает с наценкой на рынке. Она занимается этим делом в течение 6 лет. Теперь у нее накопилось достаточного опыта в этой сфере и она хочет увеличить поголовье скота. С этой целью Кизларой берет кредит для купли и перепродажи скота и за счет прибыли расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Qizlaroy lives in the Khuroson region. She is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband and sons are currently abroad, earning a living as migrant workers. Qizlaroy herself works in animal husbandry. She buys both large and small livestock, fattens them, and sells them at the market for a profit. She has been doing this kind of work for 6 years. Now that she has a wealth of experience in this field, she wants to increase her herd. For this reason, Qizlaroy is seeking a loan so that she can purchase more livestock to fatten and sell. She plans to use the profit to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Fuarosa

texts.en:
Fuarosa, age 37, sells German-style buns in her community to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years. She and her husband have two children.

Fuarosa joined SPBD to gain access to capital, and she has requested a loan in order to buy coconuts, flour, sugar, cooking oil, and a frying pan.

With her earnings, Fuarosa will help to support her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, flour, sugar, cooking oil, and a frying pan

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena earns an income by operating a general store business. She has been in this business for 13 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs. Magdalena is a hard-working entrepreneur who has has been successfully sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF.

Magdalena is presently requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 14,000 through NWTF, which she will use to buy items to sell in her store, such as shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, soap, milk, and coffee.

Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: o buy items to sell in her store, such as shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, soap, milk, and coffee

loans.name: Loisi

texts.en:
Loisi is 32 years old, married,  and has five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas, which she has been doing for three years. 

Loisi is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy chemicals, fertilizer, wheelbarrow, and shovels. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Loisi hopes to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, wheelbarrow, shovels, gloves, and bush knives,.

loans.name: Elégbédé

texts.fr: Âgé de 46ans et père de 04 enfants dont 03 enfants à l’école, elégbédé  a pour femme une revendeuse.  Il est quant à lui revendeur de CD, de cassette et d’appareils électroniques. Son activité se fait dans une boutique. Vu que les demandes des clients augmentent, il sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises (CD, cassettes, appareils électroniques). Avec le profit qu’il va réaliser, mr Elégbédi veut voir ses enfants réussir tout en augmentant son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Elégbédé is 46 years old and the father of four children, three of whom attend school. His wife works as a vendor. Elégbédé is a vendor himself, and sells CDs, cassettes and electronics. Elégbédé runs his business from a shop.

Due to an increase in demand by his customers, Elégbédé is seeking his second loan from WAGES. He will use the loan to purchase merchandise, including CDs, cassettes, and electronics. With the income he generates using this loan, Elégbédé wants to see his children succeed while increasing his stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, cassettes, and electronics

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut is a member of the Tunjung Wiguna group. With her last loan, she managed to earn a good profit, and her increased income was very helpful to her family's finances, particularly since she is experiencing difficult times due to the increasing expenses involved in supporting a family.

Ni Ketut has decided to request an additional loan from MUK due to the fact that the loan funds have been extremely valuable in developing her pig-raising businesses. She will use her loan to buy four piglets and pig feed. 

Her goal is for her business to support the daily needs of her family, allow her to increase her savings, and pay for her children's education.

(One member shown in the picture has resigned from the group because she had to accompany her husband when he obtained work in the city.)

loans.use: to buy four piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is married and has seven children.  She is engaged in the hog raising business, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. Her husband is a farmer.

Romana is requesting for a loan, which she will use to buy additional piglets to raise and feeds.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and plans to construct a piggery to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Roseli

texts.en: Roseli, a 25-year-old married mother of two, has been running a small business selling chips in her community for four years now. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital and has requested a loan to buy taro, breadfruit, cooking oil, deep pots, and salt. With her earnings, Roseli will help meet her family's financial needs.

loans.use: to buy taro, cooking oil, cooking pots, salts, and breadfruit.

loans.name: Evelini

texts.en: Evelini,  a 29-year-old married mother of four, has a small bingo business that she has been operating for two years. Having recently joined SPBD to gain access to financial services, she is requesting a loan to buy materials for use in bingo. Evelini will use her profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new bingo machine and bingo paper.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор жительница города Вахша. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и имеет четверо детей. Муж Гулбахор занимается купле-продажей зерна. Сама Гулбахор выращивает клубнику. Она занимается земледелием в течение 12 лет. Гулбахор берет кредит для посева клубники. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность и осуществлять поставку клубники зарубежным странам.
texts.en: Gulbahor lives in the town of Vakhsh. She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband buys and sells grain, and Gulbahor grows strawberries. She has been doing this for 12 years now. She is now seeking a loan so she can plant more strawberries. She wants to expand her business to begin exporting strawberries internationally.

loans.use: to plant strawberries

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 50 years old and single, with no children. Nida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase stocks to sell, like sugar, milk, canned goods, and shampoo.

Nida has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothes. Nida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell, like sugar, milk, canned goods, and shampoo.

loans.name: Agbeko

texts.fr: Revendeur de CD et de matériels électroniques dans un baraque, Agbeko jeune homme de 34ans est marié à une secrétaire et ils ont 01 enfant en charge. C’est en 2006 qu’il a démarré son activité et sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour l’achat des  marchandises. Il veut réinvestir dans son activité et assurer un avenir radieux à la famille.
texts.en: Agbeko is a CD and electronic materials vendor who operates his business out of a stall. He is 34 years old and is married to a secretary with whom he has one dependent child. Agbeko started his business in 2006 and is seeking his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase merchandise. He wants to reinvest in his business and ensure a bright future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, bulbs, and electronic materials for resale.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 57 years old and married to a farmer. They live harmoniously in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to inadequate income, she runs a small variety store in their village to generate additional income. She aimed to improve the business and make it more profitable in order to support her family needs and save for future emergencies. She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000.00 to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings, fruits and vegetables to sell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will help her to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, snack foods, noodles, soaps, beverages, seasonings, fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nao

texts.en:
Nao is a determined and responsible woman who strives to work hard to give her family a better quality of life. She is 45 years old and has only one child. In the rainy season, she devotes at least eight hours daily working in her rice paddy to ensure a fruitful harvest. However, she doesn’t possess enough land to grow each year. She had just rented a piece of land from local residents in order to maintain a high rate of her rice products and gain more income. 

Due to financial difficulties, she is asking for a loan of USD 500 to pay land fees. She realizes that this financial assistance will surely make improvements in the business and earn her good revenue. Her dream is to educate her child up to college, so he might be successful in his lifetime.

loans.use: to pay land fees for rice farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her fruit-selling business with fruits such as watermelons, bananas, papaya, mangos, melons, coconut and medlar.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.en: Celestino is 28 years old, single and is currently residing with his parents and two siblings at the village of Calaocan. He has a livestock business raising hogs. His net income when he sells six hogs is PHP 8,000. He would like a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase hogs to raise and sell. His profits usually go to the family's daily expenditures at home. He is hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can use it to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase some hogs to raise and sell

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Visitacion works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs.  Visitacion is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Visitacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 42 years old, married and a mother of two children from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a food vending business selling roasted chicken. Her husband runs and operates a tricycle transport business. Patricia is asking for a loan to buy spare materials for the tricycle including nuts and bolts, wheel tires and screws. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the vehicle. In the future, Patricia aims to expand their two businesses and make them more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy spare materials for tricycle, including nuts and bolts, wheel tires and screws

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is 50 years old and is married to Merlita. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children.

To make a living, Rudy is engaged in a hog-raising business. He has been running his business for 10 years and earns 2,500 PHP per piglet. At this time, Rudy is asking for a loan in the amount of 19,000 PHP to buy feed, vaccine and an additional hog to raise. He hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and an additional hog to raise

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
The Kerto Sato group gets their fifth loan from MUK. With 10 members, the total loan is 15 million IDR.  One member couldn't attend the meeting because of sickness.

The loan will be used to buy piglets and repair cages. Ni Ketut, as the head of the group, is using the loan to buy 2 superior piglets and also feed. The price for the superior pig breed is currently very expensive, ranging from 400,000 - 500,000 IDR. These pigs will be maintained for 5 months for fattening. 

Ni Ketut expects that during the loan period the pig will be able to develop properly without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream to fix her house.

loans.use: to buy 2 superior piglets and also feed

loans.name: Hougbeke

texts.fr: Gérant d’un cyber dans un quartier de la place, Hougbeke est marié à une revendeuse et père d’un(01) enfant.  En 2012, il a commencé son activité et s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant d’assurer un bon avenir à sa famille. Il est aidé par 02 personnes et sollicite son second crédit pour acheter des accessoires d’ordinateurs et pour l’aménagement de son cyber. Il désire ouvrir d’autres cybers dans les quartiers reculés et construire  une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Hougbeke is married to a retailer and is the father of one child. He has been managing an internet cafe in a neighborhood in his district since 2012. Hougbeke enjoys his business, as it allows him to earn sufficient income to ensure a good future for his family.

Hougbeke has two assistants, and is seeking his second loan to purchase computer accessories and to make improvements to his internet cafe. Hougbeke's goals are to open other internet cafes in remote areas and to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories and to make improvements to his internet cafe.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel is 27 years old and is a very friendly and helpful woman.  She currently has a cellphone shop in her village. Over the two years of operating this occupation, their underprivileged lifestyle was improved. She started doing such a business as she began to have her own family and she didn't want her family to experience difficulties in living. This causes her to become a hard worker and fascinated in operating a business to avoid an awful life.

She wants to make high profits so, for this reason, she is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy new models of cellphones as her customers requested. She believes that providing for customer demand will increase her income. Madel hopes for her loan to be granted.

loans.use: to buy new models of cellphones as her customers requested

loans.name: Vaai

texts.en:
Vaai is a 41-year-old woman who is married with 4 children. She has a sewing business and has had 5 years with this business.

Vaai needs a loan to buy material, thread, a sewing machine and needles. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. Vaai joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, needles, threads and fabric material

loans.name: Estebana De Jesus

texts.es:
Estebana de 54 años de edad, casada con un hijo de 9 años, originaria de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central de la región. En sus ratos libres  le gusta mucho disfrutar de actividades creativas con su pequeño hijo, como ir al cine ver películas. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Estebana se caracteriza por ser una mujer, trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, y brindarle mejores condiciones a su hijo es que tiene por actividad económica la venta de bisutería que consisten en vender productos como adorno del cabello para niñas y adultos colas, peinetas, diademas, cintillos, papel de regalos, unas acrílicas, pinturas de unas, tintes para el cabello. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en unos de los mercados de la localidad. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. La rutina de trabajo de Estebana es trabajar unas 8horas diaria. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos.  Estebana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Estebana is 54 years old, married and has one nine year old son.  She is originally from Managua, in the centre of the region.  In her free time she really enjoys doing creative activities with her young son, like going to see films at the cinema.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, Estebana could not study at university as she had to work from a very young age to help with costs at home.  Estebana is a hard-working and responsible woman who wants to overcome problems.

Thanks to her a strength and her desire to prosper and offer better conditions to her son. Estebana makes a living selling costume jewellery, which includes products such as hair decorations for girls and adults, combs, headbands, hairbands, wrapping paper, acrylic nails, nail varnish and hair dyes.  Her business is situated in one of the area's markets.  She does this work with great pleasure.  Estebana works eight hours a day.  The aim is to invest her credit in working capital and to buy products to stock up her business and sell.  She hopes soon to be earning more money.  Estebana thanks Kiva investors for the help they provide so that people with little resources have a decent job and for the help they provide to poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock up her personal products business with items such as hair decorations for girls and adults, combs, headbands, hairbands, wrapping paper, acrylic nails, nail varnish and hair dyes.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina tiene 41 años, tiene por pareja a Felix de 46 años y junto a el la alegría de contar con 5 preciosos hijos de distintas edades para quienes otorgan lo mejor de su trabajo.
Reside junto a su familia en una vivienda construida a base de madera. Desde muy niña se desempeña en actividades concernientes a la producción de cacao y café orgánico cuyo oficio fue instruido por sus padres desde siempre.
Gracias a unas parcelas que obtuvo en calidad de herencia, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidades que presenta la zona en donde radica, como por ejemplo las constantes lluvias, y eso ha dificultado dar mantenimiento y deshierbo de maleza. Pero por ahora, lo que le preocupa es ofrecer a su familia una seguridad en la casa donde viven. Sus planes apuntan en la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble  es por ello que necesita 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de calaminas, tablas y lograr realizar una mejora considerable para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paulina is 41 years old.  She has a partner, 46 year old Felix, and together they are happy to have five beautiful children, all of different ages, for whom they do their best work.

Paulina lives with her family in a wooden house.  Since she was a little girl she has been working to produce organic cacao and coffee.  She was always taught this trade by her parents.

Thanks to some plots of land that she inherited, Paulina has managed to move her family forward, in spite of problems in the region where she lives, such as constant rain.  This has made maintenance and weeding difficult but, for now, what worries her is being able to provide safety for her family at home.  Her plan is to build a house with better materials and so for this she needs 1000 Nuevo Soles to buy corrugated iron and boards.  She wants to make significant improvements for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron and boards and to make major improvements for the well-being of her children.

loans.name: Yolanda Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda Francisca esta soltera, tiene 20 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, se dedica a al tejido de cortes típicos y a la confección de delantales, en varios diseños, inicio este trabajo siendo operaria desde los 14 años hasta ahora lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su mamá que la aytuda en su trabajo,


Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos, esto on el fin que su negocio sea mas prospera y tenga mas ventas, espera en el futuro tener su propio capital y un negocio grande, para así segur apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Yolanda Francisca is single, 20- years old and finished six years of primary school.  She makes her living weaving and making aprons in a variety of designs.  She started out as a worker when she was 14-years old, so she has six years of experience.  She has her mother's support; her mother helps her in her work. 


Señora Yolanda Francisca is requesting the loan to purchase fabric and thread with the intention of making her business more prosperous and having more sales.  She hopes, in the future, to have her own capital and a large business so she can continue helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase thread for weaving.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad, 60 years of age, is married to a farmer and they blessed with 11 children. Some of their children are already married. They are currently residing in the village of Villa Concepcion. 

Natividad has been selling fruits and vegetables in their village for almost 15 years and she's earning a net income of PHP 6,000 per month. She would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase a bicycle with a side-car for use in selling fruits and vegetables. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she can gain more income for their better future.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle with a side-car to use in selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: Edelyn, a 44-year-old mother of three, has been selling seafood for three years in her village to make a living. Despite the difficulties of walking everyday, she is inspired by the prospect of achieving a better living. To help meet her dream, Edelyn is requesting a loan of P8,000 to buy more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.es:
Alfonsa tiene 52 años, divorciada y con 3 grandes responsabilidades aún que son sus hijos Juan de 18 años, Yuliza de 14 años y Marco de 12 años. Vive en una casa  hecha a  base de madera. Ella se dedica integralmente a la producción de cacao orgánico en unas parcelas que heredó de sus padres con motivo de recompensar tantos años de trabajo que brindó ayuda cuando era niña.
Lleva casi 34 años desempeñándose de manera independiente y siempre con el proposito de apoyar a sus hijos.
Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que siente tener vocación para su labor, no obstante las actividades de sacar la maleza son complicadas y forzosas y más aún cuando hay temporada de lluvias y necsita de ayuda para dar mantnimiento de sus plantas. Sus planes a largo plazo apunta en la compra de una moto para solucionar el problema de transporte que aqueja, puesto que en épocas de cocecha sus parcelas se encuentran ubicadas en una zona lejana de la ciudad, incrementando el coste de producción final debido al precio que tiene que pagar por el transporte del mismo. Este es su primer préstamo, a su vez se siente muy contento por la oportunidad brindada esperando siempre ser una socia muy puntual el pago de sus cuotas.
En esta primera ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para contratar jornaleros y llevar a cabo el deshierbo de sus plantaciones de cacao correspondiente a la campaña productiva.
texts.en:
Alfonsa is 52-years old and divorced.  She has three great responsibilities, her children.  Juan is 18-years old, Yuliza is 14-years old and Marco is 12-years old.  She lives in a house made of wood.  She makes her living growing organic cacao on one of the plots of land she inherited from her parents in recognition of the many years of work she gave to her family as a young girl.
She has been living independently for almost 34 years.  Her purpose has always been to support her children. 
Alfonsa is very grateful for her work, as she feels she a knack for it.  Even so, removing the weeds is a complicated necessity, especially in the rainy season.  She needs help maintaining her plants.  Alfonsa's long-term plan is geared toward purchasing a motorcycle, which would solve her transportation woes.  It becomes a problem at harvest time because her plots of land are located far from the city.  Her final production costs are increased by having to pay for transportation from the farm to the city.  This is Alfonsa's first loan.  She feels very happy for the opportunity offered to her and expects to always be punctual in the repayment of her loan. 
On this first occasion, she needs 1,000 nuevos soles ($400) to hire day laborers and carry out the weeding of her cacao plantings during this productive season.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando vive con sus padres en la zona sur del país, se ha dedicado siempre a la agrícultura, actividad con la cual mantiene a su familia. Está solicitando un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) para la compra de semilla de maíz, abono granular y fungicidas para proteger sus cultivos durante el desarrollo y evitar también que aparezcan hongos y plagas en sus plantaciones, El vende la cosecha en una asociación de la localidad y de esta manera ayuda a sus padres, y hace frente a otras obligaciones económicas, desea llegar a ser un productor grande y prosperar y tener mayores ingresos y comodidades para él y su familia y para ello hace el mayor de sus esfuerzos en la actividad agrícola.
texts.en: Orlando lives with his parents in the country’s southern zone; he’s always worked in agriculture, an activity that supports his family.  He’s asking for a five-hundred thousand colon (¢500.000) loan to buy corn seeds, granular fertilizer and fungicide to protect his crops during the growing phase and to prevent mold and infestations from attacking his plants.  He sells his harvest in a local association thus helping his parents.  He also covers other economic needs and he’d like to become a large producer and become prosperous earning higher income to have greater comfort for him and his family.  To do so, he puts all his efforts into his agricultural activity.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Karanjung Lestari 2 Group

texts.en:
The Karanjung Lestari 2 Group gets the second loan from Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK). With eight members, the combined loans are IDR 28,000,000. The loans will be used to buy piglets and feed and to repair cages.

Ni Made, as the head of the group, will use her loan to buy feed only, because she already has six superior piglets. Good quality feed is currently very expensive. She has a plan to sell the piglets as fattened pigs. Ni Made expects that, during the loan period, the pigs will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream to fix her house.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Peñafrancia

texts.en:
Peñafrancia is 30 years old and raises her family in their community. She aims to educate her children and give them a bright future. Despite the hardships of life, Peñafrancia is striving hard to earn income for the improvement of their lives. 

She is currently engaged in selling fish and shrimp in the village. She usually earns profits of PHP 200 a day that she uses to purchase their necessities needed every day. 

Peñafrancia is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish and shrimp to sell. She hopes that through this loan, she can continuously acquire and provide a better income.

loans.use: to buy fish and shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Pasac 1 Group

texts.es:
Miguel (la tercera persona con playera de color blanco y rayas negras de derecha a izquierda de la fotografía) un hombre de 51 años de edad el está en casado y vive en Sololá. El tiene siete hijos de ellos tres mujer quien ayuda en los oficios del hogar y cuatro  varones quienes  tres de ellos trabajan ayudando a don Miguel en el campo de la agricultura y uno que está casado trabajando independientemente.
 El se dedica al cultivo y al mantenimiento de banano, café  y de la hoja de MAXAN (hoja que se utiliza en la cocina guatemalteca para empacar alimentos, ver fondo de la fotografía) la labor que le da a esta hoja es natural  utilizando fertilizante orgánico y prácticas que no atentan la naturaleza esto le da lugar a ser amigable con el medio ambiente.  Aprendió este trabajo junto a su padre porque es una de las actividades que más se realiza en la región.
De esta manara decide realizar su propio cultivo comprando una parcela a tres  kilometro de su vivienda de este modo el tiene ahora 22 años de experiencia trabajando independientemente. El vende su producto en el mercado local  viendo  que su ganancia es buena y quiere seguir invirtiendo capital para ampliar su cultivo.
Es un hombre  líder en su comunidad organizando un grupo de personas por la cual solicita un préstamo para ampliar su cultivo comprando fertilizante orgánico, plantas de de MAXAN para próxima siembra y el pago a trabajadores que preparan las parcelas. 
El sueña que en un futuro pueda comprar otra parcela y seguir ampliando su cultivo y obtener más y mejores ganancias para la economía familiar. Los demás integrantes de este grupo se dedican a esta misma actividad cultivando y dándole el mantenimiento a la hoja de MAXÁN que es una de las principales actividades de la región en la generación de trabajo.
texts.en:
Miguel (third from right to left wearing a white shirt with black stripes) is a 51-year-old, married man living in Sololá.  He has seven children.  Three of them are girls that help with household chores and four are boys that help Miguel with the agricultural chores; one is married and works independently.

He works growing and caring for banana, coffee and maxan leaf (a leaf used in Guatemalan cooking to wrap food; see plants in photo background) crops.  The care he provides for this leaf is natural and he uses organic fertilizer and practices that don’t damage nature which is a friendly way to treat the environment.  He learned this work alongside his father because it’s one of the most common activities in the region.

He decided to grow his own crops and bought a parcel of land located three kilometers from his house; he now has 22 years’ experience working independently.  He sells his crops in the local market and his profits are good.  He wants to continue investing capital to expand crops.

He is a leader in his community and organized a group of people through which he’s requesting a loan to expand his crops buying organic fertilizer, maxan plants for the next planting cycle and to pay laborers to prepare the soil.
