She is taking a loan of 1500 SSP to purchase dodo, okra, lemons, and many other items. She has no other source of income aside from this business.

In five years, Karama would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include the high prices in the market. Karama says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like dodo, okra, lemons, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10.  All of them go to school.

Sarah runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 1000 SSP to purchase onions, beans, and many other items.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years sarah would like to expand her   business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Sarah says she is happy with the loans given by Finance Sudan   through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like onions, beans, etc

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru:
Заявитель Айсулуу, 1969 года рождения, замужем, имеет троих детей, образование среднее.  В ведении хозяйства и бизнеса помогают муж и сын. 
За время оформления документов заемщик показал себя с положительной стороны, как человек ответственный и предприимчивый, умеющий правильно вести хозяйство и вкладывать средства по назначению, среди соседей и знакомых имеет авторитет, характеризуется как человек отзывчивый и доброжелательный. 
Свой бизнес заемщица начинала в 1990 году, с накопленных 4 000 KGS. Муж заемщицы является местным чабаном и занимается выпасом КРС местных жителей. В настоящее время Айсулуу в своем активе имеет 6 голов КРС. Имеются все условия для содержания скота. Кроме животноводства, заемщица занимается полеводством. На 1,15га земельного надела ежегодно выращивают хлопок. Свою деятельность осуществляет на основании своего многолетнего опыта, знает все тонкости в сфере животноводства и полеводства. Айсулуу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, семян и удобрений. За счет прибыли от проекта заемщик собирается отремонтировать свой дом и летнюю кухню.
texts.en:
Aisuluu, the applicant, was born in 1969, is married, and has three children.  She has a secondary education. Her husband and son help her with the household and business. 

While filling out the loan application, the borrower gave a very positive impression as someone who is responsible and enterprising, able to run a farm make investments properly. She is respected among her neighbors and friends, and has been described as someone who is sympathetic and friendly. 

She began her business in 1990 with 4,000 KGS. Her husband is a cattleman who grazes cattle for local residents. Currently, Aisuluu has six head of cattle. She has everything necessary to maintain the cattle properly. In addition to animal husbandry, she farms.  She has a 1.5 hectare plot of land where she grows cotton every year. She has many years of experience, and she knows the ins and outs of livestock care and farming. Aisuluu has asked Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 KGS to buy livestock, seed, and fertilizer. With the profit she earns from the loan, the borrower is going to renovate her house and summer kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase cattle, fertilizer, and seeds

loans.name: Kethegbeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present the members of the “Kathegbeh” group. These are three small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,200,000 Leones for each in order to invest in their respective businesses.
 
Adama is the leader of this group. Adama is 40, married to a driver and has six children. Two of the children are in primary school and four in secondary school. Adama sells market food such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper, onions, etc.  She has been doing this for many years. 

With the help of this loan, Adama will invest in her business by buying palm oil, pepper, onions, etc. in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, peppers, onions, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 42 years old and is married. He and his wife are blessed with three children. 

Antonio is engaged in a hog-raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. He has three heads of sow. Sometimes he has difficulties in feeding his pigs, which is why he decided to request a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. 

He hopes to maintain his business for the future of his family. He will manage his business well, and gain higher income to save some of it for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs

loans.name: Orozgul

texts.ru: Орозгул 58 лет, замужем, они с мужем воспитали 4 детей. Дети Орозгул взрослые две дочери не замужем живут с родителями. Орозгул с 1995 года начала заниматься животноводством, стартовав с 10,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Орозгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется очень развитое хозяйство, приносящее около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Орозгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма. Доходы от кредита Орозгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства. В ближайшем будущем собирается выдать замуж дочерей. Они у нее кстати близнецы.
texts.en: Orozgul is 58 years old, married, and she and her husband have raised four children. Orozgul's children are adults, but her two single daughters live with their parents.  In 1995, Orozgul began working in animal husbandry and started the business with 10,000 KGS.  Thanks to Orozgul's hard work, her farm is now highly developed and brings in about 10,000 KGS per month. In order to further expand her business, Orozgul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy cattle for fattening. With the income from the loan, Orozgul plans to invest in further expanding her farm. In the near future she plans to marry off her daughters who are, by the way, twins.

loans.use: purchase a cow and fertilizer.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.ru: Катерина – из Ужгорода. Она уже много лет работает старшим оператором станционного технологического центра на Львовской железной дороге. Совсем недавно ее сын принял решение жениться. Катерина очень хочет помочь ему финансово. Она решила сделать свадебный подарок молодым и хотела бы приобрести для них спальню. Сумма в 5 000 гривен необходима ей именно для того, чтобы приобрести подарок сыну.
texts.en:
Katerina is from Uzhgorod. She has worked as the most senior cleaner at the station technological center of Lvov's railway for many years. 

Very recently her son made the decision to get married. Katerina would like to help him financially. She decided to give the young a wedding present and would like to purchase a bed for them. The amount of 5,000 hryvnia is necessary precisely in order to purchase the present for her son.

loans.use: to purchase a bed as a wedding present for her son

loans.name: Roberto Isaias

texts.es: El señor Roberto, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en la comarca de nombre La Borgoña, su esposa e hijos lo apoyan en todas sus decisiones ya que el busca siempre la mejoria para el hogar, el cultiva Piña desde hace mas de 15 años, sus planes es poder ofrecerles un hogar digno a sus hijos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, actualmente comprara insumos y Fertilizantes para darle mantenimiento a su cultivo. Agradece el apoyo brindado por parte de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Roberto lives in the town of Ticuantepe, in the rural district named La Borgoña. His wife and children support him in every decision he makes, since he's always seeking to improve their household. He has been growing pineapples for over 15 years. His goal is to be able to provide a decent home for his children and improve their living conditions. At the moment he'll purchase supplies and fertilizers in order to maintain his crop. He gives thanks to Afodenic and Kiva for the support he's been given.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers in order to maintain his crop.

loans.name: Sodikboy

texts.ru:
Содикбой, мужчина в возрасте 51 года, родился в сельской местности в семье рабочих.  Женат и имеет 2 детей. Жена Содикбоя нигде не работает , так как не имеет высшего образования.   Она занимается воспитание детей. Содикбою очень тяжело , так как он единственный кормилец в семье.
 Работает Содикчон  у себя в мастерской, занимается ремонтом холодильников, кондиционеров, пылесосов и других электроприборов. Он имеет огромное количество клиентов в своем селе.  Мастерская Содикбойя в очень плохом состоянии и нуждается в ремонте.  Он работает в плохих условиях.   
По совету знакомых Содикбой решил подать заявку и получить кредит. На полученный кредит он планирует купить строительные материалы и  отремонтировать свою мастерскую.  Содикбой заранее благодарит организацию Кива за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Sodikboy is a man of the age of 51 years. He was born on the countryside in a blue collar family. He is married and has two children. Sodikboy's wife does not work anywhere, as she does not have high school education. She is engaged in raising the children. It is very tough for Sodikboy, as he is the only provider for the family.

Sodikboy works in his own studio, repairing fridges, air conditioners, vacuum cleaners and other electronic devices. He has a large number of clients in his village. Sodikboy's studio is in a very poor state, and is in need of repair. He works under bad conditions. 

At the advice of an acquaintance, Sodikboy decided to apply for and receive a loan. For the loan received, he plans to invest in building materials and repair his studio. Sodikboy thanks the Kiva organization in advance for the financial support and help.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a rice buying and selling business in the Philippines. She has been doing this for nine years.

Helen requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 45 years old, married with six children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business over 10 years.  Each month, she earns 1,500 PHP doing this type of business. She joined GDMPC since year 2010. She requested a loan of 5,500 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure . In the future, she wants to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida is 53 years old and operates an eatery as a source of income. She has been operating her business for 12 years and earns 5,000 PHP monthly. With her family's daily expenses, this amount is not enough. She wants to increase her sales and needs a loan amount of 20,000 PHP to buy meat, vegetables, bread, and rice. She hopes this loan will contribute to the success of her business and, therefore, improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, bread, and rice

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is married. Isabelita is 52 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Isabelita buy and sells rice to earn a living and had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more sacks of rice to sell/retail. Isabelita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Isabelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell/retail

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie, 53 years old, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with three children. She manages a direct sales business through which she has been selling personal use products for almost six years. In this business she's earning a net income of PHP 15,000 a month. 

Josie would like to take a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP to purchase personal use products such as cosmetics, perfumes, and facial creams to sell. According to her, she also sells purified and alkaline water in their village for additional income, but she focuses more on direct selling the personal products. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can expand and continue to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase personal use products such as cosmetics, perfumes, and facial creams to sell

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann raise pigs as her primary source of income. At age 25, she needs to work hard to provide for the needs of her parents, as well as her siblings. She dreams of lifting her family from their poor living conditions, which is why she works hard on her business. 

She wants also to provide for the needs of her pigs, therefore she is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to buy feed and vitamins. 

She hopes this will make them fit and nourish them, providing higher sales at when she sells them.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Walther Mauricio

texts.es: Don Walter continua con su labor como fotógrafo trabajo con el que le ha ayudado a pagar sus créditos y hacer crecer a sus hijos que son adolecentes de 16 y 18 años y su esposa a la par vendiendo cosméticos y ropa para ayudarle con los gastos ya que la vida cada vez es más cara hoy en día solicita su noveno crédito para comprar una cámara fotográfica instantánea profesional de mejor calidad ya que sus clientes le exigen mejor resolución de fotos.
texts.en:
Walter continues to work as a photographer. This work has helped him pay his loans and raise his teenage children aged 16 and 18.  

His wife sells cosmetics and clothes to help with expenses since life keeps getting more expensive. 

Today he is asking for his ninth loan to buy a good quality professional instant camera since his clients are requesting photos with better resolution.

loans.use: to buy a professional camera.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married with 3 children. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Letecia is a farmer and grows assorted crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan to pawn a parcel of coco land. 

Letecia has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.

loans.use: To pawn a parcel of coco land

loans.name: Gerson

texts.en:
Gerson is 38 years old and lives in Birayan. He is married with two children. 

Gerson has a buy and sell lumber business and earns approximately PHP 12,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to purchase logs. 

Gerson has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to pay for logs.

loans.name: Elbert

texts.en:
Elbert is single with no child. Elbert is 22 years old and lives in Solinog, Calamba.

To earn a living, Elbert has a motorcycle transport business. He has had this business for two years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 3,000. Elbert has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase spare motor parts.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 42 years old and lives in Oyan, Sibutad. He is married with 3 children. 

Pablo has a copra and charcoal business and earns approximately PHP 4500 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to invest in rice and corn to retail as his new business.

Pablo has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: start a rice and corn selling business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a coffee farmer aged 35 years, is married with four children. He started farming way back after dropping out of school. He did so many jobs but failed due to his education level. This could not lead him to a moderate life standard. 

He then decided to concentrate on coffee farming which has given him a new life. As of today, Charles has managed to build a home for his family, and he can raise school fees for the children and take care of their medical bills. His main challenge now is that he wants more capital to buy fertilizers and also to be able start processing his own coffee so that he can sell it at a high price. 

In order to achieve his dreams, Charles started borrowing from UGAFODE and has now applied for a loan of UGX 800,000. He believes he will pay well and get other bigger loans in the future. He is a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 55 years old, married and had children to sustain.  Elena is a store owner in Alcala. She sells grocery items to the people in her village; she patiently attends to the needs of her customers who come and buy merchandise at her store. 

She would like to continuously offer good merchandise, which is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP10,000 to  buy more grocery items such as noodles, sardines, bread, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to sell. It will help increase her sales capacity, and income as well. 

With good income, she will achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy more grcoery items such as noodles, sardines, bread, biscuits, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 56 years old, a widow and had three children. She is a vendor, and happily gains income from selling bananas to the people in her village. She buys bananas at wholesale, and sells them at a retail price. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month. 

She hopes to buy more bananas to sell, which is why she is asking for PHP 5,000. This will help her increase her sales.

In the future, she hopes to keep improving her sales, and save for her family's sustenance.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
As the widowed mother of eight children, Catalina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a food production business. Catalina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries like shampoo, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items

Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like shampoo, canned goods, and other miscellaneous items to resell.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is 35 years old and still single. She aimed to become successful and financially stable in order to support her parents and her younger brothers and sisters. Due to lack of job opportunities, she has engaged in selling coffins and providing funeral services in the local community. She has been operating the business for almost 15 years. 

She aims to make more coffins to sell, but she does not have enough capital to acquire the needed materials. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of  of PHP 50,000 to cover labor costs and buy wood, paints, labor and other materials needed in making coffins to sell. Through this loan, she believes that she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints, steel and other materials needed in making coffins for sale

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 23-year-old single lady; she is one of seven brothers and sisters.

Rasha is studying at the university to become a school teacher. She is applying for this loan to pay for her university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 41 years old. He is a married man and has three children who are five, nine, and fourteen. He is a hardworking man who will always work hard for his family. 

Samuel is an electrician who deals with electronic devices. He has been in this business for the last 22 years, gaining a good amount of experience. He makes a comfortable monthly income of KES 50,000. He is taking his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to add more stock of electronics for sale. He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business.

His dream is to become the most stable businessman in the region.

loans.use: to add more stock of electronics

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 56 years old and married with three children.

Merle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stock items to sell, like snack foods, spices, eggs, noodles, and shampoo.

Merle has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Merle aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell, like snack foods, spices, eggs, noodles, and shampoo.

loans.name: Penta Farm Group

texts.en:
Gedeon is a member of the Penta Farm Group in Kakamega South District. He is pictured with 15 One Acre Fund farmers, 7 women and 8 men (the field officer is standing on the left of the photo). Gedeon is standing on the right with his hand raised. 

He is asking for a loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. 

Gedeon first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 long rains, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 long rains season. Gedeon joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer; it makes the community come together.

Gedeon reports that before working with One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 1.5 bags of maize per 1/4 acre, but with his One Acre Fund loan during long rains 2012, he harvested 4 bags per 1/4 acre! 

He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, and perhaps to invest in another business. 

Gedeon’s group members will each receive loans for a  ½ acre of production during the 2013 long rains season. In total, they will receive loans for 7.5 acres of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification is 59 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Purification has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. Purification has been in this business for 20 years.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products to sell.

In the future, Purification would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is 52 years old and married with nine children.

Emeliana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Emeliana has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Emeliana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a 58-year-old resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is a widow and mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business together with her children. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nimfa operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones to much larger doormats, as well as other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding down the highway in a speeding jeepney. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nimfa dreams that her business will grow even more and hopes to have a happy and good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her work and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 33 years old and a responsible mother of two. She is married, and she manages a small store for income. She sells grocery items to the poeple in her village. She usually earns about PHP 200 each day. Her income pays for meals and business expenses. 

She hopes to keep making her business profitable, and that is why she is asking for PHP 5,000 to buy sardines, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, and breads to sell in her store. She hopes to keep extending good products and services to all her valued customers.

loans.use: To buy sardines, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, and breads to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy floor scraps for her husband's scrap-selling business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad (pedicab) rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad for her trisikad rental business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for two years. Mary Ann earns more income from food vending.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (pedicab) for her trisikad rental business.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old farmer and mother of three; her husband is a teacher. Mary keeps animals and plants crops, but her agriculture and livestock businesses face the challenges of drought. The animals do not have water to drink, and the crops do not have enough rain to grow. 

Mary is encouraged by the tree growth she has seen on the land of farmers who planted with KOMAZA in past years. Mary wants to join the KOMAZA micro-forestry program so that "tree-farming skills and income will be shared in the family." She intends to use her profits from the tree farm to educate her children and improve her farming endeavors.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical training and maintenance support.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en: Monaliza is a hog-raiser in her village. She is 21 years old and a single parent. Despite being a single parent, she works hard to give her child a better life. Right now, Monaliza is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the maintenance of her hogs. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for the maintenance of her hogs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy items such as snack foods and soft drinks to sell in her general store. Elvira has been in this business for 10 years. She also earns income from food vending and raising pigs.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as snack foods and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Basma, 45 years old, is a widow. After her husband passed away, she was left to look after their eight sons and daughters. Her older sons are now working in farming, like she does, but it is not enough. She started a clothing sales business at home after work, selling women's country-side dresses. She is now applying for a loan to stock more clothing items other than dresses and clothing that will be more appropriate for younger ages. By offering a greater variety, she hopes to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing items for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to care for his crops.

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es: El joven Freddy habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe en el populoso reparto llamado Juan Ramon Padilla, junto a su familia, el labora  para una empresa privada en la capital, su sueño es tener su casa propia, actualmente vive con su Mama y con este credito construira un cuarto para tener mayor privacidad, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le esta brindando.
texts.en:
The young Freddy lives with his family in the municipality of Tucuantepe in a populous neighborhood called Juan Ramon Padilla. He works for a private enterprise in Managua, the capital. His dream is to have his own house. At present, he is living with his Mother and by means of this loan, he will be able to construct a room so that he can have more privacy.

Freddy is very grateful for the help that Afodenic and the Kiva Funds are offering.

loans.use: buy construction materials.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old and married with one child.

Teresa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock items to sell in her general store, like soap, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, and eggs.

Teresa has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Teresa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock items to sell in her general store, like soap, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, and eggs.

loans.name: Nelson Billy

texts.es: El Joven Nelson habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos el sueña con tener una casa digna y gozar de buenas condiciones, su espos alo apoya en todas sus decisiones, ella le ayuda con los gastos del hogar ya que es comerciante y el  tiene su negocio donde vende, Zapatos, Ropa, Sillas y mesas platicas. con este nuevo credito  comprara Materiales de Construcion para levantar parte de la pared de su casa. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondo Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Nelson lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with his wife and children. He dreams of having a nice house in good condition. His wife supports him in all his decisions, and she helps him with the household expenses as he is a merchant. He has a business where he sells shoes, clothing, chairs and plastic tables. With this new loan he will buy construction materials to build part of the wall of his house. He appreciates the support that Afodenic and and the Kiva lenders have given.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita, age 55, is requesting a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos to buy onions, cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar and soft drinks. She will put these goods in her store as additional goods. Her customers will be happy, because these good are always their requests. She hopes that her business will succeed so that she can save and provide for the unending needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy onions, cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar and soft drinks

loans.name: Mwanzo Group

texts.en:
Florence is a member of Mwanzo Group in Kakamega South District. She is pictured with eleven One Acre Fund farmers – nine women and two men. Florence is standing on the right in a blue dress. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Florence first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Florence joined One Acre Fund in order to produce more food to sell.

Florence reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about three bags of maize per ½ acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested nine bags per 1/2 acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and buy a cow. 

Florence’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 5.5 acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Jonna Joy

texts.en:
Jonna Joy is 30 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jonna Joy is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Jonna Joy has been farming vegetables for two years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm equipment

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en:
Meswalehe is 43 years old and lives with her husband together with her seven children in Likoni Kenya. All of the children attend school. She is a hard working business woman who owns a food cafe in which she sells meals for breakfast, lunch and supper. Her cafe is situated near Kenya port authority where there are a lot of people who work throughout the day.
She is very dedicated to her work, she is energetic, and she has many goals for the future. Her secret of success is consistency and a love of the work; she believes that anyone can achieve what they desire.
She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy seats for her cafe and to buy cooking ingredients, sacks of maize flour and bundles of wheat flour. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy seats for her cafe and buy cooking ingredients, sacks of maize flour and bundles of wheat flour.

loans.name: Vevirly

texts.en:
This is Vevirly, 27, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Nexon, a driver, and they have one child. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vevirly operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 to help her in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion of her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Vevirly hopes that her business will grow and have more products. She dreams that her family will live happily. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Gai Bol

texts.en: Gai is a 32-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 2 children, aged 7 and 5, both attending school. Gai has operated a bar/hotel for 6 years and has two employees. Gai has benefited from previous loans as he has had an increase in sales, so he has been able to pay part of his children's school fees. He is planning to expanding his business and says he is happy for the loans provided by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy items such as fridges, soda, beer, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma and her husband are responsible parents who aim to improve their standard of living to give their children a better life. They agreed to continue sending their three children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. In this regard, Wilma planned to improve her small variety store in order to generate sufficient income. She is asking for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of rice, dried fish, canned goods, beverages, seasonings and vegetables to sell. Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she will improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, dried fish, canned goods, beverages, seasonings and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks such as soap, canned goods, shampoo, eggs, milk and sugar for her general store business.

Mercedita has been in this business for 12 years. Mercedita also earns income from farming sugarcane. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase stocks such as soap, canned goods, shampoo, eggs, milk and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Remedios successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build and expand her business.

NWTF is relisting Remedios's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 28 years old and supports six people. Julius runs a small baking business in Kabarnet town. He has been in business for the last five years, and his monthly income from the business is KES 50,000. He is borrowing KES 100,000 which he intends to use to a purchase a commercial plot for his business.

He plans to continue investing in the business, as well as saving money to enable him to develop the plot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a business premise.

loans.name: Romanico

texts.en: Romanico is 43 years old and is married with three children. To make a living, Romanico is engaged in a hog-raising business. He has been in this business for three years and earns about PHP 7,500 every four months. Romanico is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins to sustain the growth of his hogs. He hopes he can improve his business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins to sustain the growth of his hogs

loans.name: Dúo Bella Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO BELLA ESPERANZA 

LA SEÑORA MAYRA XIOMARA VIVEN EN ALTA LOMAS DE JOCOTENANGO  ANTIGUA  GUATEMALA DEPARTAMENTO DE SACATEPEQUEZ, ES MUY TRABAJADORA LE ENCANTA LAS VENTAS , ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ZAPATOS  .  ELLA NO TIENEN LOCAL, SINO QUE ELLA VA DE CASA EN CASA OFRECIENDO SU PRODUCTO, Y ASI SE HA DADO A CONOCER  COMO BUENA VENDEDORA Y ASI SE HA AYUDADO CON SUS GASTOS PARA SUS HIJAS  YAQUE SUS HIJAS SON PEQUEÑAS TODAVIA  AUN TIENEN MUCHO QUE DARLES ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE ZAPATOS.
texts.en: This is the communal bank "Duo Bella Esperanza."  Mayra Xiomara lives in the Alta Lomas neighborhood of Jocotenango, near Antigua, Guatemala, in the department of Sacatepequez.  She is very hardworking, and loves to sell.  She has a business selling shoes.  She doesn't have a store, so she goes door-to-door offering her products for sale.  In this way, she's become well known as a good saleswoman.  With this business, she has helped to pay for her daughters' expenses, because they are still very young and so she still has a lot that she needs to give them.  She is requesting this loan to buy shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Nayabelle

texts.en:
Nayabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as rice, soft drinks, dried fish and other groceries needed for her business.

Nayabelle has been in this business for eight years. She also earns income from pig fattening, raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

Nayabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as rice, soft drinks, dried fish and other groceries needed in her business.

loans.name: Isaac German

texts.es:
El señora Isaac German esta casado, tiene 25 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion media, tiene 1 hijo pequeño, se dedica a la talabartería, la elaboración de calzados para hombres en diferentes tamaños, trabajo que inició siendo operario, hasta el momento lleva 1 año de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para pagar el alquiler del local donde trabaja, ya que quiere que su negocio crezca y tenga mas ventas, por eso cada día elabora nuevos diseños, espera tener otro local de venta de calzado.
texts.en:
Isaac Germán, 25, is married and has one small child.  He completed the three years of intermediate education.

He makes a living in leather goods making men's footwear in different sizes, a job he began as a worker.  Currently he has a year of experience.  He has the support of his wife, who takes care of the household.

He's requesting the loan to pay the rent on the place he works.  He wants his business to grow and have more sales, so every day he makes new designs.  He hopes to have another shoe store.

loans.use: to pay rent on his work space

loans.name: Dúo Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Dúo Fortaleza, este duo esta integrado por el señor Jose, quien se dedica al cultivo de verduras, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para seguir cultivando espera que le puedan dseguir dando ese apoyo que nececita para salir adelante.
texts.en: This is the communal bank "Dúo Fortaleza."  Jose, a member of the bank, is a farmer who cultivates vegetables.  He's been farming for a number of years.   He is requesting this loan so that he can buy seeds and organic fertilizer to continue cultivating his crops.  He hopes that you can continue to provide the support that he needs in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a widow with two adult children. Though she is a single parent, she is still able to manage her business and family well. Esperanza has owned and run a variety store for ten years. With her income from the business, she is able to meet their daily necessities and give her family comfortable living conditions.

Esperanza would like to take out a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy a variety of groceries such as cooking oil, canned goods, shampoo, instant noodles and assorted biscuits to re-stock her variety store. She hopes that this loan will help her to attain her goal in life – most especially for the continuous smooth flow of her business. In this way, she can earn a higher income which will serve her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries such as cooking oil, canned goods, shampoo, instant noodles and assorted biscuits to re-stock her variety store

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 19 años quien es soltero y vive en Sololá. Tiene cinco hermanos varones y 2 mujeres.
El es un joven trabajador quien actualmente se dedica al comercio de abarrotes en una tienda que tiene a unos kilómetros de su vivienda. Esta actividad lo aprendió cuando tenía 15 años trabajo con unos amigos  fuera de su pueblo porque su necesidad lo obligo a hacerlo  dejando  la escuela ya que sufrió el fallecimiento de su madre, de este modo el tenia que apoyar a su padre para darle lo necesario  a su  familia. Ahora  cuenta con 4 años de experiencia  y eso lo llevo a ser  independiente teniendo  su propia tienda de abarrotes.
El ha visto que la demanda  de sus clientes es buena así como sus ganancias y necesita tener más variedad de productos  para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para ampliar su tienda comprando más productos para que pueda obtener mejores ganancias,  seguir creciendo y apoyando la economía de su familia ya que una de sus metas  que quiere cumplir.
El sueña para un futuro tener otra tienda de abarrotes generándole más y mejores ganancias para que pueda construir su propia vivienda y seguir apoyando a sus hermanos pequeños para que sigan estudiando en la escuela.
texts.en:
Carlos, 19, is single and lives in Sololá.  He has five brothers and two sisters.  He's a hardworking young man who currently makes a living selling groceries in a store a few kilometers from his house.

He learned this job when he was 15.  He worked with some friends outside of his town because he needed to do it, leaving school because of the death of his mother.  So he had to help his father with the family necessities.  Now he has four years of experience, which has made him independent, with his own grocery store.

He has seen that customer demand is good, as are his profits, and he needs to have a greater variety to give his customers better service.

He's requesting a loan for 5,000.00 Q [GTQ] to expand his store, buying more products so he can get more profit and continue growing and supporting the family economy, one of his goals he wants to achieve.

He dreams of having another grocery store in the future to generate more and better profits so he can continue building his own house and supporting his younger siblings so they stay in school.

loans.use: to buy groceries to expand his store

loans.name: Esperanza Yamileth

texts.es:
Esperanza es mujer de 26 años de edad casada, madre de 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son menores de edad y los otros dos están estudiando en la escuela, junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles en pequeña escala, ella se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 12 años siendo sus padres agricultores desde toda una vida los que le enseñaron el cultivo de granos básicos, Esperanza no pudo terminar de estudiar la primaria completa, cursando hasta el 3 grado por falta de apoyo económico. Ella  aprendió como trabajar la tierra lo cual además de dedicarse al cultivo de granos básicos también decidió aprender a cultivar Chile dulce para generar más ingresos debido a que es un producto rentable, en cuanto al comercio, es fácil de vender y de distribuir. Sus cultivos están a una distancia de 100 metros de su casa de habitación a los cuales diariamente se traslada a pie, lo que le facilita el monitoreo constante del mismo ya que es un cultivo que necesita bastante mantenimiento y asistencia técnica como la limpieza, riego, abono, fertilizantes, control de plagas, etc.

Hoy en día Esperanza solicita ayuda para poder comprar semilla para la siembra de Chile para poder distribuirlo y venderlo en la zona ya que sus sueños son educar a sus 4 hijos menores para que ellos tengan una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de empleo y un mejor nivel de educación.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a 26 year-old married woman.  She has 4 children: 2 of them are attending school and the other 2 are younger. Along with her husband, she cultivates staple grains such as corn and beans on a small scale.  She has been farming for more than 12 years.  Her parents, who worked as farmers all of her life, taught her how to cultivate staple grains.  Esperanza was not able to complete her primary education; she finished only 3rd grade, due to a lack of financial resources.

Esperanza has learned how to work the land.  In addition to staple grains, she also decided to learn how to cultivate sweet peppers so that she could generate more income, as this is a profitable product.  It is also a product that is easy to sell and distribute.  

Esperanza's crops are located a distance of 100 meters from her house, and she walks there daily so that she can constantly monitor them.  Her crops require quite a bit of maintenance and care. She must weed and water them, fertilize them, control the pests, etc.

At this time, Esperanza is requesting help so that she can buy seeds to plant peppers that she will distribute and sell in the area.  Her dreams are to educate her 4 young children so that they can have a better quality of life, better work opportunities, and a better education.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant peppers

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban se ha dedicado desde hace varios  muchos años a la ageicultura, vive en una comunidad situada en la zona Sur de Costa Rica, aquí la economía está  basada en actividades agropecuarias,  El está solicitando un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (¢500.000) para la compra de semilla de maíz, frijol e insumos agrícolas como abonos, insecticidas, herbicidas  para el mantenimiento y desarrollo del cultivo , manifiesta sentirse feliz con la oportunidad de financiamiento que se le brinda .
texts.en: Esteban has worked in agriculture for many years. He lives in a community located in the southern part of Costa Rica. There the economy is based on agricultural activities. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 colones in order to purchase seeds for corn and beans, and agricultural supplies like fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides for the maintenance and development of crops. He expressed that he feels happy with the financing opportunity that is being offered to him.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sandra Cleotilde

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Cleotilde esta casda, tiene 29 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educacion secundaria, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la elaboración de bordado de blusas a mano, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su esposo, hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos de varios colores, y que espera que su negocio sea prospero y grande, espera en el futuro tener maquinas para hacer estos trabajo, de forma mas rápida.
texts.en:
Sandra Cleotilde is married and is 29 years old.  She completed 4 years of secondary school and has 2 children who are in school.  She works embroidering blouses by hand.  

She started this business thanks to the support of her husband.  She has 3 years of experience and has the support of her husband, who works knitting cortes (traditional skirts).

She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy fabric and thread of many different colors.  She hopes that her business becomes prosperous and large.  In the future, she hopes to have sewing machines to do this work more quickly.

loans.use: buy embroidery materials.

loans.name: Reina Adali

texts.es: Doña Reyna tiene 15 años de trabajar en venta de ropa usada ella le avisa a su clientela cuando va a tener nueva mercadería cuenta con la ayuda de su ex esposo y así ha logrado que su hija se gradúe de su carrera universitaria lo cual la llena de mucha alegría y orgullo, ella con sus ganancias ayuda a su familia en especial a su madre, solicita el crédito para comprar variedades de ropa como pantalones, camisas, calzado de damas y caballeros de segunda con esta inversión espera ir creciendo para en un futuro lograr poner una tienda más grande en un departamento de Managua para que la atienda su hijo.
texts.en: Reina has worked selling used clothing for 15 years. She lets her customers know when she is going to have new merchandise. She has help from her ex-husband, and this way she has made sure that her daughter graduated from college, which fills her with a lot of joy and pride. With her income, she helps her family, especially her mother. She is asking for the loan to buy assorted second-hand clothing like pants, shirts, and men's and women's footwear. With this investment, she hopes to keep growing, so that in the future she can set up a larger store in a department of Managua for her son to manage.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing like pants, shirts, and men's and women's footwear.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth es una madre emprendedora y muy trabajadora, desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de la ganadería, tiene tres hijos que le ayudan a cuidar el ganado. Elizabeth compra vacas para obtener crías que luego somete al proceso de engorde  hasta que alcancen el peso y tamaño ideal y las vende en las ferias ganaderas locales, renueva su ganado cada año y para esto solicita un crédito de un millón cuarenta mil colones (¢1.040.000)para comprar 6 vacas y realizar este proceso, ella y sus hijos se sienten felices de poder obtener financiamiento para este tipo de actividad.
texts.en: Elizabeth is an enterprising and very hardworking mother. She learned about raising livestock when she was very young. She has three children that help her to care for the cattle. Elizabeth buys cows to get calves, which she fattens until they reach an ideal weight and size. She sells them in local livestock fairs. She renews her livestock every year, and for this she is asking for a loan of 1,040,000 colones to buy six cows and start this process. She and her children are glad to be able to get financing for this kind of activity.

loans.use: to buy six cows.

loans.name: Alfonso Javier

texts.es: Don Alfonso es un cliente que se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos desde hace 12 años su esposa a la par también vende queso, con sus ingresos ayuda a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela y se preparen para su futuro, don Alfonso no quiere que sus hijos tengan la misma suerte que él quien no ha podido encontrar un empleo porque no termino sus estudios lo cual para él es una gran dificultad. Esta optando por un primer crédito para realizar el porche de su casa por lo que necesita comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, perlines, bloques y arena.
texts.en: Alfonso is a client who has sold dairy products for the past 12 years. His wife also sells cheese. With their income, they help their children so that they go to school and prepare for their future. Alfonso doesn't want his children to have the same fate he did. He has been unable to find work because he never finished school, which is a major obstacle for him. He is asking for his first loan because he wants to build a porch on his house, so he needs to buy construction materials like cement, purlins, cinderblocks, and sand.

loans.use: for construction materials like cement, purlins, cinderblocks, and sand.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos tiene una tienda de abarrotes muy visitada por los vecinos del lugar, a los cuales les ofrece sus productos, la exigencia de más artículos necesarios para el consumo diario ha hecho que Juan Carlos solicite un préstamo por quinientos sesenta mil colones (¢560.000) para surtir su negocio de abarrotes y otros artículos y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en: Juan Carlos has a grocery store that is frequented by the neighbors in the area.  There he offers his products.  Since there is more demand for everyday consumer products, Juan Carlos is requesting a loan in the amount of 560,000 CRC so that he can restock his grocery store and acquire other goods in order to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy rubber shoes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Argentina Azucena

texts.es: Doña argentina de 51 años es una señora sola muy trabajadora que ha procreado 6 hijos  que ya son independientes y le ayudan a ella, los ha sacado adelante con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo continua con su medio de sobrevivencia la venta verduras, leña en el carretón de caballo con lo que ha podido pagar sus crédito ahora lo solicita para hacer un pequeño anexo en su casa  de la mina de zinc por lo que necesita comprar laminas de zinc, perlines, colosos y pagar la mano de obra para ir mejorando su pequeña vivienda.
texts.en:
Argentina is single and 51 years old.  She is very hardworking and has raised 6 children.  They are now grown and help her out.  She has helped them get ahead with a lot of work and continual effort with her means of survival: selling vegetables and firewood via horse-drawn wagon.  

With the profits of these activities, she has been able to pay off her past loans and now asks for one to make a small attachment to her metal-sided house.  For this reason, she needs to buy zinc sheet metal, support beams (purlins), construction screws, and pay the handyman in order to keep improving her small house.

loans.use: pay the handyman and buy zinc sheet metal and support beams

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been working as a hair dresser since 2010 in order to help her husband in making a living and covering their family's expenses.

Sahar is a hard worker who is putting so much effort into improving her business in order to please her customers and earn income at the same time. 

Sahar is applying for her second loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy hair-treatment products and tools she needs. These products will surely improve her living and at the same time, reply to customers' requests.

She hopes that through the coming loans, she will be capable of renewing her washing machine and the refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy hair-treatment products and tools she needs.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 27,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Medela

texts.en: Medela, 73, is married with 4 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a tailoring business in the local community. She's been with her business over 15 years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. Medela joined GDMPC in 2009. She is requesting a loan of 32,500 PHP to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and threads. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools, such as needles and threads.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita owns and has operated her retail store for six years. According to her, she only earns about 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) monthly. She utilizes this income for basic necessities and other household expenses.

Julita would like to buy stock of merchandise to restock her retail store, but due to an abrupt increase of her household expenses, her income is no longer enough to buy merchandise. For this reason, Julita is asking for additional capital of 5,000 PHP. She believes that through borrowing additional capital from lenders, she can further improve her sales and profit. Julita would be thankful if her requested loan amount will be approved.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as eggs, ingredients, instant noodles and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 60 years old, married and supports his four children aged between 16 and 10 years old. He is a farmer who is practicing both horticulture and dairy farming. He has been in this operation for 20 years, earning an income of 16,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).  

Edward has borrowed a loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD, this being his second loan, and he intends to use this amount to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.  

The profits he earns from the sale of his farm products will be used to buy one dairy cow and repay the loan. He hopes to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Patricia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Patricia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, canned goods, spices, energy drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, shampoo, canned goods, spices, energy drinks, etc.to sell

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is now 47 years old and living happily with her eight children and her spouse. She practices horticulture on their farm and it's now been in operation for 21 years. Her monthly income has increased to KES 10,000.

She is servicing her second loan of KES 30,000 with KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. She intends to use this amount to purchase seedlings and fertilizers and prepare more seed beds. 

The profits she earns will be used to plough back into her farm.  She hopes for a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 27,000 PHP loan for to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosemarie dreams that she will have a bigger stall for her store and hopes to give her child a good life and a future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 46-year-old lady. She is married with seven children, all of whom are still in school. Her major expenditure is school fees. Asha has a small food stall near her home where she sells food and drinks.

She requested a loan for KSH 40,000 to buy cooking ingredients and drinks in large amount such as sacks of potatoes, onions and wheat flour bundles. She is grateful for such an opportunity.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and drinks in large amounts.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Rosalyn is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, toothpaste, milk, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Rosalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, soap, spices, toothpaste, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet, being a serious businesswoman, has benefited a lot from her previous loans. She bought some type of hair lotions, weaves and many other items, and is now taking a new loan to open another branch to generate many clients. She says that she is happy for Kiva and Finance South Sudan's continuous support of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more weaves, plastic chairs for the customers and other related items.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is 32 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Chona owns and manages a business selling fish in the local community. She's been with her business over five years and earns 30,000 PHP a month. She joined GDMPC in 2007. Chona is requesting a loan of 38,000 PHP to rent a fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to rent a fishing boat.

loans.name: Sukadeba

texts.en:
Sukadeba is a 44-year-old differently able person living with his wife and his children. He is running a cycle repair shop at the market. He earns 7,000 INR from this business. He repairs bicycles. But he needs to go to the market to obtain the required spare parts to repair bicycles as and when required. He does not have enough funds to have these spare parts in stock. As a physically challenged person, it is difficult to go to the market very frequently and he is not able to provide the service on time. He wants to purchase these spare parts in bulk and improve his customer service by reducing the turnaround time for the repairs.
 
Sukadeba has applied for a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase spare parts like free wheels, chains, tyres, seat covers etc, which are frequently needed in his repair work. This will help to repair bicycles on time, provide better service to his customers, attract more customers and prevent frequent trips to the market. He says he will earn 9,000 to 10,000 INR per month from this business.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle spare parts like free wheels, chains, tyres, seat covers etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 36 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a business raising pigs for sale to earn a living. She's been with her business for over five years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. She joined GDMPC in 2009 and now she is requesting a loan of 8,500 PHP to purchase additional feed for her pig. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Risper is a member of the Imani Group in Kakamega South District. She is pictured with 15 One Acre Fund farmers, 12 women and 3 men. Risper is standing on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ acre of maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. Risper first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2010 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Risper joined One Acre Fund in order to access the best input prices and use her increased profits to send her children to school.

Risper reports that before One Acre Fund, she was able to grow about one bag of maize per 3/4 acre, but with her One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, she harvested 11 bags per 3/4 acre! She plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Risper’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 7.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Umara Tubit

texts.en: Umara benefited a lot from her previous loans. She increased her stock by buying more hair lotions, weaves, and many other items. She is now taking a new loan to open up a new salon in the market to generate extra money and she says that she is happy for the loans.

loans.use: to open a new beauty salon

loans.name: Alla

texts.ru:
Алла занимается торговлей женской обувью. Она живет и работает в Белой Церкви, Центральная Украина. Алла работает на одном из крупных местных рынков. Преимущества ее бизнеса состоит в том, что обувь, которую продает Алла, качественная, без большой наценки, так как она приобретает ее на фабрике без посредников. Алла торгует на рынке – имеет 2 точки, а также в магазине уже на протяжении 7 лет. Ее чистая прибыль составляет немногим более 4 000 гривен.  
Сумма в 15 000 гривен понадобилась Алле для того, чтобы закупить партию весенней обуви.
texts.en:
Alla sells women's shoes. She lives and works in Belaya Tserkov in the Central Ukraine. Alla works on one of the largest local markets. Her business advantages are that the shoes that she sells are high quality without high markup because she buys them directly from the manufacturer and not the middlemen. Alla sells on the market and has two locations and also a store where she has been selling for seven years. Her clean profit is a little bit more than 4,000 hryvnia.

Alla needs a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvnia to she can buy a batch of spring shoes.

loans.use: to buy a batch of spring shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Khamade

texts.fr: Khamade est un homme qui exerce l'activité agricole en saison pluvieuse. Il pratique aussi l'élevage après les récoltes. Il achète des boeufs, les engraisse et les revend.Cela lui permet d'améliorer ses revenus afin de prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de sa famille. Il sollicite un pret de 250 000f pour acheter des beoufs. Il ambitionne de construire un enclos bien sécurisé pour pouvoir étendre son activité.
texts.en: Khamade is a man who farms during the rainy season. He also does livestock farming after the harvest. He buys bullocks, fattens them up, and then sells them. This helps him increase his income to enable him to assume his own expenses and to provide for his family. He requests a loan of 250 000 F to purchase bullocks. He wants to build a secure enclosure in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy bullocks.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquin

texts.es: Pedro siempre trabajando junto a su esposa en su negocio de venta de fritanga comida típica del país negocio con 12 años de experiencia  lo que le ha ayudado a pagar los estudios de sus dos hijos, este es su segundo crédito solicitado con Afodenic para invertir en su negocio comprando granos básicos, plátanos, carnes y verduras para aumentar las ventas y en un futuro lograr poner una fritanga mas grande, esto será posible gracias al apoyo de financiamiento por lo que está muy agradecido.
texts.en:
Pedro always works together with his wife selling “fritanga”, a mix of different traditional Nicaraguan foods. He has been doing this for twelve years now, which has helped him pay for the education of his two children.

This is his second loan with AFODENIC. He will invest in his business and buy basic grains, plantains, different types of meat and vegetables. This will increase his sales and lead to a larger “fritanga” stall in the future. All of this is possible thanks to the financial support he has received, something he really appreciates.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, plantains, different types of meat and vegetables for his food stall.

loans.name: Sandiguème Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Sandiguème" se compose de deux femmes.Elles sont mariées et ont des enfants.Elles se sont mis ensemble pour se soutenir mutuellement dans leurs activités d'embouche ovine. Elles achètent ainsi des moutons à des prix bon marché,se les partagent et les revendent sur le marché local après les avoir engraissé  au bout de 7 mois.Elles parviennent à obtenir des revenus assez consistants leur permettant de subvenir à leurs besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de leurs familles respectives. Le chef du groupe( à droite sur la photo), est mère de deux enfants. Elle fait l'embouche à domicile et aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses d'entretien de leur famille.Elles sollicitent un pret de 100 000f pour acheter des moutons.
texts.en: The Sandiguème group is made up of two women. They are both married with children. They got together to give each other mutual support in their sheep fattening businesses. They purchase sheep at low prices, share them out, and sell them at the local market after seven months of fattening. They manage to obtain fairly substantial incomes which enable them to provide for themselves and for their families. The leader of the group (on the right in the photo) has two children. She fattens her livestock at home and gives her husband considerable help with the expenses and upkeep of their family. She requests a loan of 100 000f to buy sheep.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Nop

texts.en:
Nop is 35 years old and married with three dependent children. She resides with her children in a public gathering area of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. Nop has been a lotus plant vendor since her husband passed away a few years ago. The lotus plant is a popular vegetable for most Cambodian people. Nop rides her old bike to collect her lotus plants for free from the lakes in her area, and she brings them to sell at a local market. Also, she sells lotus fruits seasonally and sells flowers to Buddhists on special religious days. She is able to generate approximately USD 5.00 per day.

Nop wants to upgrade her transportation to a motorcycle but due to inadequate capital she has been unable to do so.  She is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to support in her retail business and for home use. By doing so Nop can cut down her incurred expenses she has to pay for transportation services. Her dream is to educate her three children to become professional teachers for state schools.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to support in her retail business and for home use.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en: Connie is 41 years old, and married with 1 child. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Connie owns and operates farmland.  She plants and harvests water spinach for sale. She's been with business over 4 years and earns 1,500PHP every month. Connie joined GDMPC in 2012. Connie is requesting a loan of 5,000PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia is 34 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband is a tailor while all of her children are students.
Shazia as a member of 7-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan in order to use it for purchasing clothing for her clothing business.
For the past 12 years she has been running a clothing business. Her income plays a vital role for the family.
She purchases clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market of her community.

She wants the financing to purchase more clothes to sell in the market, as her clothing stock is very low. Presently she is facing a very difficult time as she doesn't have the money to pay for her house rent and their children's school fees. Therefore she hopes that the loan will be positive one for her so that she can put aside some savings for the future.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
Note: In the picture Shazia is raising her hand.

loans.use: To purchase clothings to sell.

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en: Virgina is a 49 years old, married with 3 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and manages a fish selling business in the local community and earns 2,000PHP every month. She's been doing this for over 5 years. Virgina joined GDPMC in 2009, and now she is requesting a loan of 7,000PHP to purchase additional nets and hooks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nets and hooks.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 56 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
